Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad to say”
Reviews.Author: Mom23lads
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my 11 year old son for 4 days. I'd have to try real hard to find problems with this hotel. It is reasonably priced for Venice and you get a quiet, clean hotel on a lovely square. Breakfast is good in the sister hotel on the grand canal and the same hotel has very helpful staff at front desk who will happily answer all of your questions and help you out. I wish they had wi-fi without cards... it was annoying to have to key in a code every time I wanted to get on the internet - but that was a minor issue.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel, superb location”
Reviews.Author: claudiac67
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at the Villa Igea Hotel in Venice. The hotel is in a superb location, just meters from San Marco square and from the Canal Grande. It is the three-star sister of a nearby four-star hotel. Check-in and breakfast are, however, done in the four-star hotel. Rooms are big and well-furnished. Bathrooms are renovated and well-equipped. Staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Mariaxita
Reviews.Content: Very good located. Vaporetto stop in fron of the hotel. Very clean and organized. Good price. I reccomend

Reviews.Title: “a peaceful haven but close to the bustle of this fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: willum101
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting Venice annually for the last 14 years, the last 12 of which we have stayed in the Villa Igea and it never disappoints. The rooms are not huge (in our experience Venetian hotel rooms are small unless you can afford the 5 star establishments), but what it lacks in size the rooms in which we have stayed have always come up to standard in terms of facilties and style. Spotlessly clean, stacks of hot water and showers powerful enough for us, comfortably firm beds, quality linen and pretty room decoration and furniture. Breakfast is taken in the neighbouring sister hotel Savoia and Jolanda is probably the best we have ever had in Venice. As we overheard the breakfast Maitre'd say "you can have bacon and eggs or a normal breakfast". It is a self service buffet style breakfast with a huge choice so that you can have a bit of everything on offer if that is what you want, and many guests do! In fine weather you can eat outside and watch the world go by along the Riva. It has to be one of the best places in the world to breakast and with wonderful views across the water to San Giorgio Maggiore it makes it very special.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on your room size”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldDiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3 yrs ago and were upgraded to a Superior Room. It was lovely and spacious and we were delighted with it. This time we booked a Superior Room and we were shocked to be shown to a very small room. I went to reception, round the corner at the Savoia e Jolanda and was told that "superior" means that you get a view onto the piazza not that you get a bigger room. We offerred to pay more for a larger room but were told that nothing was available. We did have the view of the pretty church of San Zaccaria and the room was perfectly fine and comfortable, just very small with very litle space for luggage. The bathroom was not too small and did look to have been freshened up recently, both tiles and paint were sparkling. Breakfast is at the Savoia e Joland and is just fine, the location is great. When we were last there Villa Igea still had it's own reception and it did seem a little neglected now that it does not. So overall, this is a decent hotel in Venice, but we were disappointed to find we did not get the size room we thought we had booked.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: debbiek37
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely little gem for a few nights in November. The staff really couldn't have been more helpful. Our room was a bit on the small side but lovely, cosy and clean- we had a balcony looking onto a courtyard with a little fountain right outside our window. The location is amazing, just a few minutes from St Marks Square. We ate in the main hotel one night and the food was amazing, if slightly overpriced. If I returned to the city I would most definitiely consider staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been worse”
Reviews.Author: trevor1007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Villa Igea during our honeymoon in Italy. The good news is that the room was clean and the location was amazing just a couple of minutes from St Marks Square. That said, the room was small and the bathroom and shower were even smaller. We weren't thrilled with Igea but it was decent enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fab little hotel a stones throw from St Marks”
Reviews.Author: Northernstar38
Reviews.Content: This is the second time i have stayed at the Villa Igea, but the first since it has been taken over by the larger Savoia and Jolanda hote. It was still as lovely, tucked away literally two minutes walk from the San Zaccaria vappareto stop. As it was out wedding anniversary they upgraded us to one of the larger rooms with a small sitting area and a balcony overlooking the square and church. As it was late september/early october the weather was still lovely and we sat on the balcony most evenings after dinner. The hotel staff were all very polite and attentive, the receptionist was very helpful when we wished to visit the armenian monestry and telephoned to check it was open for us before giving us specific instructions on the water bus to catch etc. Breakfast was lovely, a good variety of hot and cold foods along with an ever changing selection of delivious cakes each morning. It is served in the larger hotel which is on the waterfront and each morning we sat outside overlooking the lagoon. I am planning a return trip to bring my mum and sister to Venice for the first time and will definately return to Villa Igea.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy”
Reviews.Author: Elmarie G
Reviews.Content: Very small quiet luxurious room. Breakfast is at sister hotel (very close) and has a big variety (scrambled eggs are way to oily). Nice to sit outside during the summer and look out onto the Grand Canal. At waterbus station and easy to find. Very good location next to the San Zaccaria square (very expensive around this area though) and 5min walk to the St Marco square. Our view (or lack of) was the neighbourâ€™s house. Venice is very expensive! People in Venice are generally very unfriendly and unhelpful unless they can make money out of you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: carolynintheuk
Reviews.Content: Villa Igea is a lovel hotel. As mentioned in other reviews, you check in at the Savoia around the corner from Campo San Zaccaria, where the reception staff is very friendly and happy to give reccomendations. This is also where a very nece breakfast buffet is served for guests of both hotels each mornng. The location is excellent. It is near multiple vaporetto stops and walking distance to many popular sights. If you are in venice for Biennale (as we were) it's also near quite a few of the pavillions based in the city away from Arsenale and Giardini. Our room, 608, was actually bigger than we expected based on other reviews and also had two small balconies that were very nice. We didn't have much of a view, but Venice has more than enough views as it is :) My only tiny complaint was that the beds are harder than I like but that's not a big deal as I was so worn out from all the walking and sight seeing and art-looking by the end of each day that I had no trouble sleeping. I would definitely reccomend Villa Igea to any friends travelling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming oasis in great location”
Reviews.Author: MelbournePoppy023
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at Villa Igea and were very happy with the hotel. The room was immaculate and well furnished in Venetian style, the bathroom was pretty small (extremely small shower!) but had everything you needed. The bed was very comfortable with lovely bed linen. The reception for Villa Igea is at the 4* Hotel Savoia and Jolanda around the corner facing the water so you check in there and then they bring you round the corner to Villa Igea. The hotel is on a charming little square facing the Chiesa San Zaccaria (which is a beautiful church) and its amazing how quiet the square is when you consider that its so close to everything - just a few minutes walk away the streets are jam packed! There is a little terrace where you can sit and have a drink overlooking the square or you can even buy your lunch somewhere and come and eat it there. The excellent buffet breakfast is served at the 4* Hotel Savoia and Jolanda where you can sit outside and watch the waves of tourists walk by. The staff at reception are extremely efficient and helpful. I left a couple of (very small and unimportant) things in the room when we checked out and happened to be in the area the next day and thought we'd check just in case they still had them - and they had put the items in a plastic bag for collection. I was amazed, I thought they'd just have thrown the stuff away! My only reservation with this hotel was that we had a room facing the internal air shaft and it would have been a lot nicer to have a room with a view of the square. But overall, very happy and impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jim G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011 for three nights. It was very close to the water taxi stop so very little schelpping of bags. However, it was on a small piazza (San Zaccharia) with a beautiful church so it was quiet. There is no front desk in the hotel proper but at its sister hotel close by. This is not a big deal and don't let it dissuade you. The room was really pretty and the bed super cool. The bathroom was really hyper-modern with an almost indecipherable shower. It had a keypad that was confusing. Other than that great room. The breakfast at sister hotel was excellent. You can sit outside and watch the water and boats. Finally location is perfect, few minutes to San Marco square.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnaMarisaC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2008 on our honeymoon. The rooms were quite small but very beautifully decorated and also had a very small little balcony whish was still nice to have albeit the size. Our room faced over the piazza - not sure what number it was though. The hotel also has a lovely terrace where you can sit and enjoy a bottle of wine while taking in the beauty that is Venice. We enjoyed our time here and were very comfortable. We also thought the service was very good. And it's in an excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “Three great nights .....”
Reviews.Author: Colleen P
Reviews.Content: We argree with all the poisitive remarks for this hotel. We suggest that you insist on a room that offers a view of the square and the San Zaccaria Church. We think those rooms would be numbered 505, 506, 507, 604, 605, 606, 701, 702 and 703. Other rooms would give you a view of a narrow pedestrian alley in the rear of the hotel or a view of an airshaft. You check into the Villa Igea at the Hotel Savoia & Jolanda which is on the Grand Canal .The front desk personal at the Savoia and Jolanda were extremely helpful, expecially Hans. The breakfast buffet is quite good and, weather permitting, is served on a terrace overlooking the Canal. It;s a great location for everything you want to do in Venice ... and still go back to a hotel at night where it is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “G-R-E-A-T find!”
Reviews.Author: uvadelta
Reviews.Content: Hubby researched and planned this entire trip to Italy. Word to wise, Venice streets are very narrow and can be obscure. With baggage in tow, we literally passed the street entrance and realized we had done so when confronted with another bridge. Back tracking, we wandered down San Zaccaria and found our home away from home. And what a find! We were upgraded to an apartment, which is wundabar since European rooms are small by American standards. We had a sitting room, bedroom and roomy bathroom. Dining was at Hotel Jolanda, Igea's sister hotel located about one-half block away facing the Grand Canal. Hotel and restaurant staff were friendly and accommodating. Food at the restaurant was good and filling. Breakfast was part of our room package, so we had breakfast twice, a midday snack and lunch ... all enjoyable. The Villa Igea is quaint with murano glass vases, lights, etc. on display in cases. The hotel and rooms were clean and its location is convenient to water buses, gondoliers, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely central”
Reviews.Author: m_aelag
Reviews.Content: We needed to overnight in Venice prior to a cruise and stayed in the Villa Igea particularly for its extremely central location. We were not disappointed! The best way to arrive from Marco Polo airport is to take the Alilaguna water bus (Euro 15 from the airport), and stop at the San Zaccaria station, which is the station directly next to San Marco station (it's only 5 minutes walk between the two stations). Then, literally, just cross the road to the Hotel Jolanda e Savoia, which is on the waterfront, and connected to the Villa Igea. The decor of the room we had was typically Venetian....lovely old style room. It was clean, reasonably spacious, and had a fully functional en suite. Breakfast was a full buffet...delicious! To take the cruise the next day, we just crossed the promenade again to the Alilaguna station and paid Euro 7 to Marittima. Couldn't be simpler! My wife and I would certainly not hesitate to stay at the Villa Igea next time we visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful hotel in a bustling city”
Reviews.Author: MaddyA87
Reviews.Content: Villa Igea is a little oasis of calm only a few minute's walk form Saint Mark's Square. It's the sister hotel of Sovoia and Jolanda Hotel which is where you need to check in when you arrive and also where the buffet breakfast is served. the hotels are literally around the corner from each other. The staff are friendly and the breakfast acceptable. we loved it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel right near St Mark's Square and the Canal”
Reviews.Author: Supersphere67
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this "gem" by accident while researching hotels to stay in Venice. It is just off the Grand Canal across the courtyard of the San Zaccaria church. You have to go through an archway to the courtyard which is quiet and quaint. The breakfast which is included, had choices of eggs, yogurt, several coffee cakes and strudels, muffins, cereals, juice, coffee, milk, chocolate and tea. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The room was clean and air conditioned which was great considering it was over 93 (f). We would highly recommend this hotel to our friends and anticipate we will stay here again on our next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Establishment which has poor customer service and unethical behaviour”
Reviews.Author: Flooks
Reviews.Content: Venice has many hotels and accomodation so there is no need to waste your money on this establishment. Hotel Villa Igea debited payment for a 4 night stay despite being informed (well before arrival) of emergency family circumstances which required me to leave Europe for home and therefore prevented me from coming to Venice. The hotel refused to offer even a partial refund nor an allowance to change the reservation date to next year. The hotel has failed to respond to several emails. Their lack of response resulted in a waste of time and waste of money on international phone calls. They even denied taking payment from my credit card and insisted I produce a bank statement despite informing them of the exact amount and date of the debit!! They have failed to put any effort in seeking a resolution despite my many attempts. My situation is I ended up paying for 4 nights despite not being able to stay at all! I have stayed in many different hotels around the world and the (lack of) service I have received from this establishment is embarrassing and not fitting of a 4 or even 3 star hotel. If you look at the negative reviews this hotel (as well as their sister hotel Savoia & Jolanda Venice) has received, you'll notice the hotel has not responded to any of them. They don't even care to address dissatisfaction from their customers! A hotel that has poor customer service is unlikely to care about the state of the rooms/decor/cleaniness etc so it is no surprise (in light of my dealings with them) of the poor state of the rooms mentioned in some of the reviews. Please think twice before you book with a place that has such poor customer service and unethical behaviour.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel near major sights”
Reviews.Author: khlaw04
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on our first night of a trip through Italy. The location of this hotel was great. It was very easy to get to but be aware that you must check in at the hotel Savoia that is on the main street, not the Villa Igea that is around the corner. There is a sign on the door at the Villa Igea to explain this but google map it first so you can see the location before you drag your luggage around the corner. The room was clean, which was really my main requirement, and small (not by Italian standards). The morning breakfast had great coffee and was a great way to start the day. The Concierge made some good recommendations for a walk around the city and was able to arrange a free water taxi to Murano in the morning for a glass blowing demonstration. For the price, the location, the cleanliness of the rooms, the good service and the breakfast, this hotel was a good stopover for our first night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, lovely & Clean”
Reviews.Author: Flowerpop5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in Feb.. apparently off season.. Altho didn't seem it by the amount of people around. Anyway off season - so we managed to get cheap rates (otherwise we wouldn't stay there due to cost). So becasue we got cheap rates we were expecting a pretty average room-- we were so shocked when we discovered our room! Four posted bed, seperate Lounge. Amazing bathroom- which shower that had steam function and 8 different water modes. Location great, just round the corner from what its seems everything. Make sure you walk off the beaten tracks and find little local bars- a lot cheaper beer! Breakfast- We had no problems with it. We had to go to a different hotel for our breakfast when we were there as the coffee machine was broken, just a 2min walk, so it was fine. If I had the money i'd stay here again. There was a funny smell in the lobby- but who spends time in a lobby? So who gives a flying hoot. The smell definitely does not go into the rooms. Th staff were friendly enough and the housekeeping were really great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic roof deck”
Reviews.Author: tenjes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only 2 blocks from San Marco Square, but it is lacking the crowds found there. we stayed here for a few nights and would sit on the roof deck over looking San Zaccaria church/square while sipping our wine. The front lobby does not have anyone tending it overnight, but the front door is locked and you can only unlock it with your swipe key. we always felt safe here and would recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: chacha7602
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 stayed for two nights at the beginning of July, 2011 and found it to be a very nice place to stay. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and my son-in-law really enjoyed it! Tomas, the concierge, was very helpful and even stopped and talked with my husband and me later in the day when we ran into him walking around Venice!!! He was wonderfully accommodating and offered excellent ideas for our short stay. The Hotel is in a very nice location, close to everything. It is secure and very clean and our rooms were very nice. The staff was also very helpful and brought our bags to the water taxi for us and guided us to the right location for the water taxi. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again when I return to Venice. My husband, 3 daughters and son-in-law all agree!

Reviews.Title: “Bad conditions and worst service”
Reviews.Author: CGSOvar
Reviews.Content: Not a good experience at all!! Villa Igea is no longer a real hotel! The building has no reception, no check in desk, no breakfast room and worst, none respect for their costumers! The check in and breakfast has to be taken in the nearby Hotel Savoia e Jolanda and we had a real problem with the room and the staff. When we arrived at the hotel we found our room with a 30ÂºC temperature!! The excuse was that there was a little problem with the air-conditioning. 48h latter (when we here leaving) the room temperature had only decreasing to the 26ÂºC, even if all the 48h the air-conditioning had run at full speed!! The worst was that we were offered to change the room with the excuse that the problem would be resolved! But there hasn't the case, as in all the annex bulding (were the once Villa Igea Hotel opperated) had a real problem with the AC and had no conditions to lodge their costumers!! Bad conditions and worst service by an inappropriate staff who told us all the excuses/lies in the book!! NOT RECOMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: feelymerl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the Villa Igea. Our room was a reasonable size and had a lovely view of San Zaccharia square. The room furnishings were a bit tired but it was clean and comfortable. The hotel is in a quiet location but very centrally located within a few hundred metres of San Marco. Breakfast at the Hotel Savioa e Jolanda was very good and I doubt that anyone could find a hotel where you could have breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal at the price we paid. Our one problem - a failure of the air conditioning - was sorted out promptly by the hotel staff, who we found helpful & friendly throughout our stay. Venice seems to become more and more expensive every time we visit but this hotel really bucks the trend and is a great, value for money place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice room”
Reviews.Author: EasyWalker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in late June. Location is great for touring - close to St. Mark's and to several vaporetto stops. And, allilaguna waterbus to airport is only steps away. Room was clean and well equipped, with very good temperature control. It was small but more than adequate for our touring base. Our rate included the breakfast buffet, which was excellent. Would stay here again, and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great AC”
Reviews.Author: HbsLittlehampton
Reviews.Content: stayed here on business, difficult to find and then when you do are directed to another hotel to check-in. Rooms was great, AC was very quiet and worked, no tub but large shower. Breakfast was in the hotel down the street, fairly ordinary buffet. Staff were Italian, nuff said.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay, will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Chelseagirl79
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Villa Igea was brilliant from start to finish. Venice is a truly magical and breathtaking city & our stay at the Villa Igea topped it off. The hotel is in just about the most convenient location you can find without being in the thick of the hustle and bustle. The courtyard it sits on is relatively peaceful and quaint bearing in mind you are only steps away from the main promenade. The staff we very helpful, the hotel and rooms were clean and breakfast at the sister hotel (Savoia and Jolanda - literally steps away) was plentiful and tasty. Really would recommend it to all, we'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “So Convenient”
Reviews.Author: LisaG2010
Reviews.Content: We walked off the vaporetto from the airport and found the hotel straight ahead. No wheeling luggage down cobblestone streets and over bridges! The hotel provided an apartment and champagne upon arrival. This is a nice quiet hotel with sort of funky decorations but modern kitchen and bathrooms and comfortable beds on a quiet square. It is steps away from major city sights and has a beautiful breakfast in the morning. We took advantage of the free water taxi service to Murano. Front desk staff understood English and were very helpful. I plan to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location, terrible room”
Reviews.Author: Wil90
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellant and the service is great. We only had one problem and that was our room. The room which was allocated to us is definately not on Villa Igea web site it was so small. I had to walk sideways to get between the bed and the luggage stand. The view out of the window was on to other roofs. It was impossible to put the bath mat in front of the shower as their was no room, the vanity was very large and curved and this was in the way. To dry ourselves we had to step into the bedroom. To book into this hotel go to the hotel on the waterfront called the Savoia & Joland as the Villa Igea is behind this hotel and the front door is locked. You will receive a plastic card to enter the hotel. I am not sure as to how much we paid for this room as it was booked through a travel agent. I must say that the service and the staff were excellant and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: inalu2
Reviews.Content: We traveled between march and april 2010. The place is small but comfortable (all hotels in Europe has small rooms). The daily breakfast was great! Overall, is a good place in romantic Venice, lovely!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!!”
Reviews.Author: Ana MarÃ­a
Reviews.Content: Hotel Villa Igea is a very good hotel. Please do not be discouraged with the facade of the building. Like many buildings in Venice, this old and somewhat faded hotel inside looks very nice! The best part, location! Minutes from St. MarkÂ´s Square, in front of bus station (water buses of course). Even though the hotel doesnÂ´t look to the Grand canal (itÂ´s sibling hotel does, itÂ´s called Jolanda and Savoia, a four star hotel, and even the front desk and the concierge service of our hotel is in this hotel building a few steps away) we didnÂ´t care because we were near everywhere. Staff was super kind and concierge service wonderful. The breakfast was delicious. I would recommend this hotel to everybody. Just a recommendation about Venice: may and weekend is a not recommendable combination. Venice was super super crowded. Weekdays is better in this month.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Drew49
Reviews.Content: Great hotel situated in a laneway 100 metres from the harbour front and 'one'bridge' walk to St Mark's Square. Small but well equipped room. Checking in was made difficult by not being told we had to check at another hotel fronting onto the harbour at the beginning of the laneway - there was a sign but not very explanatory. Is in the tourist part by being close to St Mark's but isn't everything, it means you are close to all the things you need to see and can still get away to great restaurants and bars. Great buffet breakfast on the harbour front, good night time meal with discount for being hotel guest. Concierge was very helpful in assisting with guides and tours. Free water taxi provided to Murano (our driver was seen in the movie 'The Tourist') but we had to find our own way back - easy. Just make sure you buy the several day water bus tickets as soon as you get there. No language problems anywhere in Venice. Definitely would recommend and we would happily go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a 3 star hotel. Small rooms with poor climate. Felt like an old Holiday Inn with the bedding and mattress to match.”
Reviews.Author: raydug
Reviews.Content: Not what we expected and were very disappointed. I don't know what we payed since it was a trip through a travel service where we asked for for star hotels and this was definitely not that.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Venezia, great service, slept soundly”
Reviews.Author: TazzaT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days, the decor was all quirky Venezian and for that we loved it. As well the service and staff were exceedingly helpful and friendly. In particular Tomasso, I think his title was Director of Guest Relations who assisted with our endless questions, luggage and arranging tours, i.e. a one hour water taxi through the canals of Venice - just wonderful. Each morning breakfast was available at the sister hotel Savoia & Jolanda on the boardwalk overlooking the water and if you arrived before 8-8.30 you had a clear view before all the stalls arrived. The hotel is in a great location and quiet, so we slept well at night; we did not eat other meals at the hotel but preferred to wander off to find a trattoria away from the main tourist areas - a much better option.

Reviews.Title: “.......Old world charm with state of the arts service.........”
Reviews.Author: artwoman67
Reviews.Content: So enjoyed being in Campo San Zaccaria in this delightful hotel. Away from the crowds, yet minutes from San Marco. I cannot say enough about the staff. My first visit was with a group of Interior Design people,but I have stayed at the hotel several times by myself. My last visit was in September of 2009 and I am looking forward to my stay this June. Did I mention the delicious breakfast buffet,a real treat.........

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: SBMinNC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hotel Villa Igea for one week in April. The hotel is conveniently located in the San Marco area of Venice. An added bonus is the ferry terminal located outside the door of the sister hotel (Savoia & Jolanda), so you donâ€™t have to drag your luggage through the streets and over bridges. Our room was very small, but that is to be expected in most European hotels. Our bedroom window opened up to a patio/sitting area which over looked San Zaccaria, so the view was wonderful. I only have two cons for this hotel. The first was with the internet connection. You had to buy a card to connect and it was a bit of a pain getting on and staying connected. The second was with the tiny stand-up shower in the bathroom. All in all, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Snug but well appointed rooms, reasonably priced v it's location to San Marco.”
Reviews.Author: ohlala123
Reviews.Content: You can see the sister hotel (for booking in) as you get off at the Alilugana stop at San Zaccaria - removing all the worries about lugging suitases up and over bridges! We had a room at the back of the hotel overlooking the small calle with 3 double opening doors onto a foot sized balcony and a secondary single room - which was great - as the square tends to have parties of guided tours at a regular rate. There's also a small 1st floor terrace you can sit out on. Breakfast was buffet style in the sister hotel. We were fortunate with the weather so ate on the terrace each morning - a very pleasant way to start the day. Granted if staying longer than a week you could get fed up with the sameness of the dishes on offer . Reception staff/porters were very friendly and they were more than happy to look after our cases for the day once we had booked out. BUT..... there's always one haha. Eating there in the evening for us was a disappointment. Whilst appreciating space is money - especially on the main promenade - presentation of food was severely lacking, service strange and I felt very much as if I was on a conveyor belt. Our meals were not served together; I'd finished my main meal before they arrived with my accompanying salad and I'd obviosuly waited too long bewtween mouthfuls cos my plate suddenly disappeared without any communiction as to whether I'd finished or not! Even with the 20% discount given to guests elements of the menu were quite pricey (As standard there is a p.p cover charge over and above your meal price and then a service charge). A bottle of water was 5.90euros-compared with 2.50euros at a restaurant a litle further along the way. That said.....Would I go there again???? - YES - it's location to the 'main attractions' puts it in line with the ease of a ski in/out resort - you can pop in/out to refresh and change; take time out from the hustle/bustle and heat; not waste time travelling to/from places and get-away from the crowds for a quiet lunch - all of which takes away the posssible need of lugging rugsacks around with beverages and the like and gives your feet time to relax haha-

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Flowerdew
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Villa Igea for three nights on our first trip to Venice. It was very easy to get to, just a short walk from the San Zaccaria vaporetto site. The convenience of arrival alone is worth the stay. There was no dragging our luggage through the tight, crowded streets of Venice. Our room overlooked the San Zaccaria plaza. It couldn't have been a better view! Breakfast was more than expected with eggs, bacon, cold meats, fruit, bread, etc. The staff was very helpful, and even allowed us to make a phone call from the lobby phone when we had an unexpected banking issue. The only draw back were the paper thin walls. I'm a troubled sleeper, so you can imagine my unhappiness when our less than courteous neighbors arrived after midnight with loud talking a laughter. A beat on the wall ended it, but we could hear their entire conversation word for word. Just be prepared. Overall a very comfortable, well located stay!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel; good price; really good location”
Reviews.Author: itrade
Reviews.Content: Stayed here - half business trip and half leisure trip. The location is really great - near Piazza S. Marco and very near the Vaparetto. Unlike several other hotels I saw, you didn't have to weave your way down narrow streets and alleys to find this one. Located right across from San Zaccaria, it was vrey easy to find. Counter staff was fine. Room was nice - actually quite large for European standards. Bathroom was small but had all the amenities. The breakfast room was undergoing renovation so we were directed to the "sister" hotel down the street. No problems there. The breakfast was quite generous and had sufficient variety. LOVED the "red" orange juice. Can't find that in the USA...

Reviews.Title: “Very GOOD experience”
Reviews.Author: AlbUK
Reviews.Content: Perfect location: right in the middle of the centre, behind San Marco Square and Basilique. Nice 20 min walk to Venice Bus/Train Station (Piazzale Roma). If you are coming from the airport by boat, there is a boat-stop 300 metres from the hotel. Great location, I insist. Nice staff (sometimes), they provided us with two umbrellas as there was a rainy day. Walkable city, you can always come back to the hotel, as it is in the middle of everything. Villa Igea is a 3 star hotel, very clean. There is a reception which closes at 8pm but the hotel is associated with the 4star hotel in the corner of the street (200 m.) , also with very gentle staff and very nice facilities and premises. There is direct phone connection with both receptions from the rooms and should you need anything in the time Villa Igea reception is closed, the staff from the other place act as if you were in their hotel. It is sort of an extension of the other hotel, working perfectly well. The breakfast buffet is the best thing of all, taking place in the 4star hotel premises. It has a VERY WIDE range of products (bacon, eggs, bread, ham, cheese, fruit, toasts, jam, butter, milk, water, natural orange juice, cereals, biscuits, hand-made cakes, croissants, etc). Staff treated us very politely. I do recommend you this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Such a good location”
Reviews.Author: Alliman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in such a superb location. Literally 2 minutes walk from the San Zaccaria jetty. So easy to get to after a long journey. Air France managed to leave our luggage in Paris but the hotel staff rallied round to ensure we had everything we needed and they also rang the airport to chase it up next day. The room was clean and tidy, a little bit tired like the whole place, but fine for us as we only went there to sleep or catch up on the news/sports results. The bed was a little bit hard and the use of two mattresses as a double bed is so annoying. Our request for a second pillow was quickly followed up. We had a room overlooking a tiny back street, which meant it was really, really quiet. No tea/coffee making facilities but I believe that's pretty standard for the continent. Breakfast was in the 'sister' hotel 1 minute away on the waterfront. The buffet was very wide-ranging (croissants, cold cuts, yoghurts, pastries etc) and included yummy scrambled egg and pancetta bacon. Coffee, speciality teas and chocolate were available from the very attentative staff. And the blood orange juice was simply delicious. All in all a great place from which to explore Venice.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: CodfordWanderer
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Villa Igea; the hotel is situated ideally for those who are intending to take in the beauty of Venice. Not easy to find on a dark and foggy night the staff made us welcome despite the lateness of the hour. Our room was spacious and very well presented with a view across San Zaccarria Square to the church (which should be visited.) The bathroom was large clean and convenient.; breakfast was provided at the sister hotel next door and was extremely comprehensive and delicious. The closeness of the hotel to St Mark's Square and the water buses and taxis were a great advantage. There are countless excellent eating places nearby. I strongly recommend Villa Igea.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: mauigal06
Reviews.Content: Comfortable small hotel in excellent location. Good staff, good onsite breakfast. Surprisingly comfortable room decorated in "venetian style" and modern bathroom overlooking square and San Zaccaria church. Quiet (except for church bells on the weekend!) and tucked just a few steps away from St. Mark's and the Grand canal - easy access to everything. Felt comfortable walking to and from in early morning and later in the evening. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel, great location and price”
Reviews.Author: Lokes_24
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. It looks nothing from the outside but inside it is comfortable, decorative and most importantly, spotlessly clean. A 2 min walk from St Mark's Square, the Bridge of Sighs and the water bus, it is in a brilliant location. The staff were very helpful, the breakfast was simple but tasty and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: travelbaguk4
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed at this great hotel and it gets better and better! This time we had a new/refurbished room with a sitting room as well as a four poster bed all decorated in lavish venitian style lots of gold and red! The bathroom had a bidet and state of the art shower cubicle so complex we could only manage a basic shower out of it- not able to work the jacussi jets! The room was perfectly clean,crisp white sheets,sufficient comps to get you by if you havnt brought your own, even a flat screen tv Breakfast used to be taken in the main hotel facigf the vapporetto stop - this time they served breakfast in the hotel. Lots of fresh fruit,yoghurt,ham,cheese,boiled and scrambled eggs and bacon,crusty rolls,biscuits,cakes,croissants,toast and jams - all very fresh . Pristine white tableclothes and all served by a very efficient friendly lady smartly dressed in a white jacket and high heels! The reception desk was manned by a series of very smart tail coated men who were impeccably polite and helpful - checking our flight times on the internet and providing a plug after I forgot ours. Finally the location is perfect - just a few steps from the vaporetto stop (san Zaccaria)- and around the corner from San Marco Only one tip - do not eat close to the hotel as some are tourist rip offs - their menus outside all seem to show the same price for similar dishes but then the quality and the quantity vary - one gave us so little to eat we had to go elsewhere and have a meal(after paying Â£50 for it) - and we are not big eaters! This hotel is very good quality and very good value in a very expensive but stunningly beautiful city!.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: gregov
Reviews.Content: Found this Hotel here on Tripadvisor, Great location on hidden square right next to St Marks square, away from the crowded tourist areas. I highly recommend every aspect of this little Hotel. Staff is friendly and accomadating. Rooms are small but cozy. Don't hesitate in booking this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel - cosy, friendly, central but with an off the beaten track feel.”
Reviews.Author: KatgrrlCT
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay after reading the other excellent reviews on TripAdvisor and felt somewhat sceptical that it could possibly be as good as it sounded. No more than 50 yards from the vaparetto stop of San Zaccaria, the hotel is exactly as described. Really easy to find and if you're dragging suitcases, it's a breeze. There's a lift if you need it but the hotel has only three floors (strangely numbered 5-7) so even walking up isn't too onerous. Breakfast is generous and included - with a variety of hot and cold options, fruit, yoghurt, cheese, cake and cereal and the staff are lovely and friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice, for the amount of time you spend in your room, why lash out on somewhere expensive, when this 3* option is such good value for money. I had a single room and my bathroom a lovely walk in shower. With an interior courtyard view with a small balcony, even though I stayed in December, I couldn't help opening the windows and stepping out to listen to the bells at midnight. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Full of atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: 1potato2
Reviews.Content: The price was great for Venice, the location very convenient, and the room was quite adorable, decorated in classic venetian style. Although we had reserved a standard double at a low, noncancellable rate, we were given a jr. suite which consisted of a small sitting room with a day bed/TV and a separate small bedroom with another TV, refrigerator, etc. The bathroom was of course tiny by American standards, but everything was tidy and cute. Both rooms had windows with no view, but this meant the room was extremely quiet. Breakfast was excellent, full of variety. We were very happy with the hotel. We were offered a discount at the Princessa restaurant at the nearby sister hotel, but were not able to use the discount because the waiter told us it was not valid on the set menu or on pizza, so be forewarned! Our only complaint is that all the hotels we stayed in on this trip were overheated, so we had to leave windows open at night and we did have some mosquitos in our room due to this! The venetian mosquitos did not seem hungry, at least--no bites, but just some bothersome buzzing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, clean and great breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: MrKeith82
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Villa Igea for its apparent location and value for money in a city notoriously expensive. The great things about the hotel from our elderly point of view were that it is close to some of the great sights of Venice and there is a lift. The hotel itself is clean and nicely furnished. The breakfasts are wonderful with grilled bacon, scrambled egg and cold meats and cheese as well as fresh fruit etc. The down side of the hotel were that on a couple of mornings there was no hot water and the lift stopped working a couple of times. However both problems were fixed quickly. The beds were comfortable the room was clean and nicely furnishedand the bathroom clean and spacious. The hotel is situated 70 metres from the San Zaccaria vaporetta stop and within walking distance of most of central Venice and this is bearing in mind that in our case 'elderly' means ages 82 and 78. The room overlooked Campo San Zaccaria and the San Zaccaria church. Just around the corner was Piazza San Marco and the Doge's palace. there are so many lovely sights in Venice that we mostly just mooched around and because the hotel was so central were able to return for an afternoon rest before setting out for the late afternoon and evening, The Campo San Zaccaria is quiet and we were not troubled by any noise. Wifi was available at a small cost payable to the Reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for San Marcos Square & within steps to San Zaccharia vaporetto stop”
Reviews.Author: suncityvagabond
Reviews.Content: Overall, great hotel. Small elevator carried us to our 3rd floor room.Room looked as depicted on internet and was spacious, although some areas a bit dusty. Bathroom spacious and clean except for moldy look of shower tiles.Hotel staff quite friendly and helpful. No restuarant on site, but a nicely deocorated breakfast room where breakfast was plentiful and tasty, a wide variety of hot and cold items. COST OF ROOM: In early October, still high season so value (I thought) a wee bit inflated, although in line (even lower) than surrounding hotels. Would stay here again. Location fantastic: Across the front entrance to San Zaccaria Gothic chuuch. In 2-3 minutes, walk to the Riva d. Schiavoni where San Zaccaria vaporetta stop is located. A couple minutes walk to Bridge of Sighs, 5 minute wallk to San Marcos Square. Easily catch vaporetto to all points along the Grand Canal and/or surrounding islands.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet charming hotel seconds from St Marco square”
Reviews.Author: aussietraveller47
Reviews.Content: This is an amazingly quiet hotel just 50 metres from the bustle of San Zaccaria vaporetto stop, 5 mins walk from St Marco's square. We stayed for 8 nights. It's a bit of a drag having to drag your suitcases bumpity bump along the cobbles from the vaporetto, but guess that's the case with any hotel in Venice. We had a room overlooking the square and church which was lovely. Our room was small but clean and the sheets were changed daily. The bathroom was small, but had a shower recess (as against the hand held shower nozzle over a bath which is often the case in Italy). Had to pay for internet access. The dining room is tiny but the breakfast was very good with fruit salad and cooked bacon and eggs as well as the other normal cereals, salamis and cheese etc. Coffee was a bit weak and lukewarm to begin with, so little blondie in the dining room suggested that we ask for a cappucino with double espresso in it, and caldissimo (the hottest), so that's what we did for the rest of our trip and managed to get strong hot coffee. We were part of a very small tour group, and some of the other guests had cold showers some of the time, so maybe have your shower early, as we didn't have any trouble with ours. There are two nearly hidden outdoor terraces, one with a swing chair, the other with tables and chairs. Staff were good.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: fiftygoingonfifteen
Reviews.Content: Great location. Clean quiet room, good breakfast. Room was small but acceptable, especially given the space premium in Venice. Lovely elevated common area porches looking over San Zaccaria church square. Negatives: No hot water one morning of two. Telephone in room did not work for our whole visit. Front desk clerk promised to get somebody to check it but we saw no sign of a repair visit nor of any positive results. In general the staff had an attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Fablous location!”
Reviews.Author: LAS12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 8 nights at the Villa Igea. It was in a wonderful location in Venice, close to St. Mark's Square, but far enough away to be quiet. The room was small, but that is not unusual for a city hotel. We had only about 50 meters to walk from the point where the water bus delivered us from the airport, and the view from our room was of a fifteenth century church. If we return to Venice, we will definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Teamonkey
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our three night stay here. The hotel is in a quiet square but is only a 5-minute walk from bustling St Mark's. Staff were welcoming and helpful. The room was on the small side but beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean, with a decent-sized bathroom with double shower. Breakfast each morning was good, with cereals, fresh fruit salad and pastries in addition to a small number of cooked items. The breakfast room is quite small so get there early! We loved the small terrace area with swing seat overlooking the church - perfect for relaxing with a bottle of Prosecco! There is also a larger terrace with several tables on the floor below. Location is perfect - within walking distance of most places and very convenient for the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop, where you can get to pretty much anywhere. (We recommend buying the 3-day travel pass, which is available for 33 euros, or for 18 euros when bought with with the Rolling Venice card for 14-29 year olds). Tickets are available from the HelloVenezia ticket offices at most major vaporetto stops. Walking is a great way to explore the hidden side streets away from the crowds of Saint Mark's square. All in all, a great place to stay for exploring Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hotel allowing us rest and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: vicky_lb1
Reviews.Content: During our trip to Italy we went to Rome, Florence, Venice and Milan- this hotel was not the most expensive during the trip but it was the nicest! After "booking" room at fastbooking.com, I selected a superior view room with a city view and when we checked in we were welcomed to a huge suite. There was a private sitting area, large bathroom and private balcony facing the church right next to the hotel. We stayed for two nights and and well worth the money- was not that expensive. We chose this hotel because it was right near St. Mark's Square and very close to the water. The only complaint about the location was its on the last vaporetto stop from the train station and the hotel tells you to take vaporetto #1- which takes 45 minutes. Tip: Stop right in front of hotel is zaccarri jolanda. Restaurant da Roberto had a really good lobster spaghetti Hotel has grand canal worthy location but without the hustle and bustle of tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: xasose
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and without any doubt we succeed on our choise. Hotels in Italy are quite expensive and normally the quality is not really good. That is not the case for "Villa Igea". Rooms are not really big but are decorated carefully, emulating a palace. Other than the room, the hotel is placed close to the main canal but not on the area crowded by tourists. Breakfast is served on a different hotel but it is even greater. You can enjoy the food seated on a table in front of the main canal. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. One of the most good value for money in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: luchyswanwick_10
Reviews.Content: Exactly as other travellers have said; the hotel is a gem in the centre of Venice. We stayed there on two occasions within a week: once for three nights and later in the week, after returning from Florence, for another night. We had a wonderful room the first time, right in front of the church and we were upgraded to a junior suit on our return. The hotel is extremely clean and the service is excellent. Breakfast was plentiful and the concierge, Matteo, was very helpful and friendly. I will definitely return to this hotel when we next come to Venice. It is just perfect and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: ConstanceWales
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Villa Igea from 9th -12th August. The hotel is located just off the front in a quiet square about four minutes walk from St Mark's Square. The rooms were exactly as described by other "trippers" and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The only small criticism we would make is that the breakfast room is quite dull, the head waitress (or so she seemed) was very stern and there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, which we really missed. But apart from that I would really recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a quiet, clean hotel with very helpful reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...and great service”
Reviews.Author: SammyPlotkin
Reviews.Content: + Two bridges away from St. Mark's Square, so very near city-center. + Still quiet and uncrowded as it shares the "campo" (square) with San Zaccaria Church. + Cozy, comfortable room; comfortable bed; very nice bathroom, large sink area with hair dryer, large shower (with a proper door, not curtain); well maintained; in-room safe. + Buffet breakfast wasn't fancy, but delicious and a great start to every day. + Ask for Thomas at the front desk...he was wonderful for local restaurant recommendations that keep you far away from the tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.....”
Reviews.Author: neha69
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the Villa Igea for 2 nights in july. The hotel is located in the heart of venice, its about a 2 minute walk from the san marco water taxi stop. The staff at the reception is helpful and speak good English. The room in which we were staying pretty big with a huge bathroom (even had a bathtub). The breakfast was also very good. You can walk almost eveywhere from the hotel. However, it is better to take a water bus pass as that allows you unlimited travel especially if you want to visit murano and burano. Also, night trip on the water bus is a good way to see venice. But please remember to validate your ticket each time you board it. The overall experience of staying in this hotel was very good and we would recommend this place to anyone looking for a place to stay in the heart of venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: munch2010
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in the heart of Venice. Nice rooms, very friendly staff. Hotel is just a minute away from San Marco. There are a lot of cool bars and restaurants just around the corner. The other advantage is that it is near the boat stop for the airport and other destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LFox2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Igea following a cruise for 2 nights - we absolutely loved this hotel. The gentlemen at the front desk were wonderful. Since we arrived early in the morning, they were more than happy to store our luggage while we toured Murano and Venice. Upon our return we found our 2 rooms to be absolutely huge and with views of San Zaccaria right outside our window. Size of the rooms was great, they were very clean and had great AC! More than aything this location is great - a quiet square just a short walk to San Marco. The breakfast room was not open while we stayed (mechanical issues) so we were able to go around the corner to Igea's sister hotel and enjoy a wonderful breakfast both mornings outside w/ views of the Grand Canal - couldn't ask for better. Overall a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Davewise
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the hotel were very pleasant and friendly. The people behind the front desk were very helpful and well-informed. They even had a free daily trip/tour of Murano scheduled for guests. The hotel is located not far from Piazza San Marco in a little square opposite one of the many churches in Venice. It's a short walk to one of the water bus stops. The breakfast was wonderful, although they did have the same food every day. Everything was very clean and well-kept. Our room was very small though, with a narrow path from the door around the beds to the bathroom. We also had no real view although they said we would - instead from our windows we saw the little terrace which overlooks the square.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: trhlbookgirl
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I enjoyed our stay here very much. The location is great, the staff is friendly, and the rooms are nice and clean. A great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: BobbyandLiz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Venice in July of 2010. The location of the hotel is wonderful. Steps from St. Mark's but in a little Piazza, with a cute churxh, quite and picture perfect. You are close to food, shopping etc. The room was very nice, and the style very Venetian. The front desk staff is friendly and very helpful. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Elliehiggo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Villa Igea for 4 nights! It's a beautiful quaint boutique like hotel! Great clean rooms, lovely breakfasts and fabulous staff! We stayed here for our 10th wedding anniversary and were so glad we did! Great location, we couldn't have chosen better if we'd have tried!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location”
Reviews.Author: NH48K
Reviews.Content: My room was the largest of all hotels I stayed in a three week trip to Stockholm, Paris, Venice, Florence and Rome. Super clean, great air conditioning, convenient to everything. The front desk or breakfast room staff wasn't overly friendly, but it wasn't a make or break issue. One hint - if you arrive later at night from the airport, and take the boat bus, try to get off close to San Zaccharia, and call in advance to get directions. That way you won't worry about arriving by boat and wandering around trying to find your hotel. We asked another hotelier and they provided good directions, but we were super nervous about not finding it!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: OystersHobartTas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after our cruise. Water taxi from port to Zacharia was 120 Euro. expensive but worth it. Arrived early and greeted by great and friendly staff. Room was brilliant, location fabulous. Vaporetto to train station cost 6.20Euro each, one way. Directions to hotel...once off at Zaccharia look for Hotel Danili..pink coloured building. Go over two bridges to your right, there is a restaurant with green shades, the lane way is nearby. . Breakfast was brilliant, we would definetely stay here again. Loved it and Venice even though it was raining for the two days we were there. Also looking for Rialto Bridge, go to clock tower in San Marks square and following the yellow signs up high on the walls.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jannibaby
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband and 2 adult children. You will most likely meet Tomaso at the front desk. You may think he is quiet and not friendly, but he is a very nice person and very helpful. He never hesitated to help with all aspects of our stay. The 2 rooms we got were spacious and spotless. The location is perfect. You were a block away from St. Mark's which was perfect. You could catch any vaporetto and any line from the San Zaccaria stop right outside our door. We were contemplating staying on the Grand Canal but really were happy with this choice. Great value for the money too.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: doodleiedo
Reviews.Content: Loved this little gem. I stayed last June and would love to go back. The staff was friendly and room was beautiful. We actually had the upstairs apartment and could not have been happier. Tomas and Mateo were professional without being stuffy and the morning staff at breakfast was always ready to cater to us. Just meters away from Piazza San Marco, Great location! Must see Joseph Martin play in the Piazza if you stay in Venice. I will definately return one day. Thank you for a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Duyo
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights. Like all Island hotels it was expensive but included a nice breakfast. However it saved on taxi and transport costs and was right next San Marco Square. Water taxis are exorbitantly priced with 40 to 100 Euros not uncommon. The public water bus is fine and only around 24 Euros per day ... The staff was excellent with the manager being particularly helpful. He was born and lives in the city and was a wealth of information. the only problem we had was that we took a "free" service over to Moreno ... the glass island it took us over alright but did not bring us back. I see many reviews that refer to small room size ... true they are not as big as equivalently priced North American ones ... but still we found them no problem. If you want a gondola ride these to are expensive (80 to 110 Euros). However ask at breakfast if any of the other guests are interested and split up the cost is much better. Had no other problems and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent staff, excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Mainiac39
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights. Big, beautiful rooms. They provided the best breakfast of our whole trip. Perfect location - not far at all from San Marco. We reserved a room and we ended up with a 2 bedroom suite for the same price. There were two terraces where guests could sit outside and relax, read a book, have a cocktail, etc. They both overlooked Campo San Zaccaria. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MPoggi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The location was excellent, close to the water bus and easy to get to all of the site. The rooms were good size, with a balcony and comfortable beds as well as nice shower. We enjoyed the entire staff, especially the front desk staff. They not only recommended places for dinner but also made reservations for us. Breakfast was impressive with both hot and cold items. I would recommend to stay here for location, price and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: azrael1234
Reviews.Content: The location is really great. Easy to get to/from from the water buses (right inside San Zacaria square). Breakfast in the morning was good (pastries, fruit, eggs, ham, etc..). Staff was helpful. Have to pay for internet (10 euro for 5 hours, or 5 euro for 2 hours). Worked out okay for a few days stay where you just want to check email occasionally. bathroom and rooms are small (or shall I say european, lol). The hotel offers a free tour to the island of murano for a glass factory tour. Go on the tour for the free taxi ride, and to watch the glass blowing, but don't buy anything from them. It's a big scam and you'll pay dearly with your pocket book. Also, make sure you know how to get back to the big island via public transit (it's not hard, but some people are taken by surprise). It's a good hotel with a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Would happily stay here again”
Reviews.Author: DougWeller
Reviews.Content: Our hopes were more than fulfilled by this lovely little hotel. Friendly, helpful staff, a good breakfast, a comfortable bed, and a fantastic location all combined to make this one of the nicest hotels we've stayed in for a moderate cost. I must mention the shower, also -- 3 different controls - one for an overhead showerhead, another for a flexible on, and finally, you can have 6 'jets' on from the wall! The only mild downside was that the room was small, but that is fairly typical of European hotels in comparison with American ones.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: WessexWanderer
Reviews.Content: The location was ideal for us, a 100 yard level walk from the Alilaguna waterbus stop at San Zaccaria from the airport, and very close to St. Mark's Square. We were made very welcome and the breakfast was especially good for the class of hotel, served in their breakfast room. The rooms were up to standard and clean. We had a snow blizzard one day during our visit, and we were very grateful that there is an excellent restaurant in an alleyway just at the back of the hotel, with a good range of main courses and mouth-watering desserts, all at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best”
Reviews.Author: Deror
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is its location â€“ right across the square from St Zachariah's church and less than 7 minutes from the Doge's Palace and Piazza St Marco. The water bus from the airport stops directly at the San Zacharia peer, which is very close to the hotel. The hotel is located behind another hotel, and at night, the front desk is closed, so you have to get keys from the hotel on the waterfront of San Zacharia peer. The hotel rooms are located on floors 3 â€“ 5 which are actually floors 2 â€“ 4. The slow elevator is not worth the wait, and if you have no suitcases, it's better to walk up the stairs. The room was very small, a 3 x 3 meter box. The bathroom had a bidet and towel warmer, but paper towels served as hand towels. There was no coffee & tea tray, nor was there any iron available. The soap and shampoo were the same colour. The room had a safe but the key was not available; we left our valuables at the front desk. Breakfast was nothing fancy. Croissant, cheese, cereal, tea & coffee. Fresh fruits and orange juice but no vegetables. In total I enjoyed the great location and the fact that from the room's small balcony I could see a wonderful piazza and the historic church of San Zacharriah.

Reviews.Title: “a carnival gem”
Reviews.Author: LondonWiggies
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights 3 days having booked independently on the back of TA reviews for the main weekend of carnival 2010. On arrival at lunchtime we were greeted with very friendly welcome and good news that their need to juggle rooms being full meant they had upgraded us to their superior sister property,savoia & jaconda at same price and room was ready! S&J is an excellent hotel with one of the best locations right on the front by san marco and san zaccharia for the main vaporetto no 1 line for everything along the grand canal. Everything was first class and friendly, but Venice is so popular (rightly) so that generally one should expect standards to be generally lower and prices higher than some other first class hotels and destinations. The murano trip was offered, but not pushy at all. We declined. We went to Burano independently. It was a fun trip but it is 3 hours round trip by vaporettos. Carnival was sensational very busy and lively but no problems at all getting around into restaurants and enjoying the fun and the sights. Villa igea and S & J very highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little hotel in a perfect location. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: cycleaddict
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location, in a quiet little square tucked behind the grand canal and about 3 mins walk from St Mark's square. The room was very small but hey, who wants to sit in their room when you're in one of the most beautiful cities in the world! It was furnished tastefully in Venetian style and had a nice walk in shower. It was very clean, staff were friendly and as we arrived late and checked in at the sister hotel a few yards away, it was the quickest check in I've ever come across! Breakfast was adequate and I realised on the 2nd day you could actually get a cappucino instead of just coffee which was nicer. We paid Â£170 for 3 nights via last minute and I thought in an absolute bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SashayLee
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Villa Igea for three nights and wished it were three weeks. This hotel is located 5 minutes from St. Mark's Square, 1 block off the Grand Canal and on a lovely square facing St. Zacharia church. Our room was immaculate and with the typical Venetian design a little jewel box. The staff was wonderful, the breakfasts delicious and we were ideally situated. In short, we loved this place and it was a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, just be careful of buying from the glass factory they send you to”
Reviews.Author: Michelle L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August 2009. I booked through hotels.com and paid 253 pounds for 3 nights. We arrived late and therefore had to check in at their sister hotel which is on esplanade but this was fine. They gave us a nice room overlooking the San Zaccaria square. The rooms are very cute and made us really feel like we were staying in a truly Venetian hotel. The hotel is very easy to get to by the water ferry from the airport, simply catch the water bus (the terminal is an easy 5-10min walk from the airport) to the San Zaccaria stop. The buses are called Alilaguna routes and you need either the BLU Line or the Linea ORO or Gold Line but I think these cost extra. The man at the ticket booth at the Alilaguna terminal was very helpful for us. The hotel is in a wonderful location, right near St Mark's square, I don't think you can beat the location of this hotel. The staff were fantastic and very helpful. The breakfast was good, a typical European breakfast with meats, cheeses, bread, fruit and boiled eggs. The only thing that is a bad memory for this is the glass factory they sent us to. We were very impressed that they gave us a free trip to Murano to visit a glass factory and to see a glass blower in action. They gave us a private water taxi there and organised it all for us. However, PLEASE BEWARE when buying from this factory. You can read my review on it, just search for 'Vecchia Murano Glass Factory'. I won't go into details here because you can read the other review and I don't want my experience with this factory to take away from the experience I had with this hotel, because it had nothing to do with them, but I just think that people should be aware because this hotel will continue to offer the trip to this factory and people need to be aware when buying from there that the costs are not only what you pay for on the day. We really loved Venice and there is so much to see and do there that I could have stayed longer than 3 nights. If you get the chance I would suggest getting an all day ferry ticket and visiting Murano (ready my review of the glass factory before buying anything though) and Burano (Burano is a very cute island with lots of brightly coloured houses). The other thing is to make sure if you do a gondola tour to barter with the guides. They started off their prices at 150 euros and we ended up getting a 45 minute tour (up through the little canals onto the Grand Canal and under the Rialto bridge) for 80 euros. Be prepared to say no and walk away if they don't give you the price you suggest because they will follow you (usually a different person, not the one you originally spoke to) and agree to the price you offered.

Reviews.Title: “i can't reccommend this hotel enough”
Reviews.Author: kathrynanna
Reviews.Content: Initially I was unsure about stating so near to the tourist loop, but the location of this hotel makes it overwhelmingly easy to get anywhere within a tiny amount of time. There are a selection of restaurants and little shop just behind the hotel that are charming and convenient, and if you only have couple of days, you are near to the major sights that you have probably come to see. I f you have a little more time, the Vaporetti are a moments walk away to take you to the further reaches of the city, at any time of day or night. On terms of the hotel, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and tidied daily. The breakfast is good, not superb, but plenty of choice and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of advantages”
Reviews.Author: BonideC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty, very Venetian and the room though small was very clean.. The staff were friendly. It is useful to have a good breakfast with a selection of cold and hot dishes pluse cereals and fruit. I would recommend drinkng tea and wandering out for a good coffeee. Odd how hotel coffee is almost consistently poor. The situation opposite San Zaccaria is delighttful and it is worth popping in to see the altar pieces and the flooded crypt (1 euro).The vaporetto stop is two minutes away though the arch where the Tabacchi gets stamps on Monday. This is useful if you time it right.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in lovely Venice”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldDiva
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Venice but our 1st time at this hotel. We were fortunate enough to get an upgrade to a deluxe room. Our room was spacious and very comfortable indeed. The location is brilliant, in a quiet campo across from a pretty little church. It is only a few minutes walk to Piazza San Marco. The staff were wonderful, helpful and polite. Venice is a lovely place to spend Christmas and although it is quite cold it is also very quiet. We enjoyed this charming hotel and would certainly stay there again. Previously we had stayed at a more expensive 4 star hotel, but our stay at Villa Igea was probably more pleasant. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jakwalker
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel tucked awayfrom the hustle and bustle in a quiet square just a few mins walk from St Mark's Square and the waterfront. A small hotel run by very polite and friendly staff who speak english and they like it when you try to speak a little Italian! The room we had was not huge but was adequate and beautifully decorated with a well equipped ensuite bathroom. The breakfast buffet had a superb range of food including cereal, fruit, cheeses, meats and a cooked breakfast if you wanted one. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely be going back as soon as we can!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel - ideally located to the action”
Reviews.Author: mendiratta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 nights Sep 1- Sep 2 the room was clean smallish size, with a OK sized, fully fitted bathroom for $180. The location of this hotel is great, just a couple of minutes walk to San Marco Square, and from San Zaccharia Vaporetto (the water bus stop on the Ali Laguna line if you are coming from the airport.). It is just off the main walk path along the Grand Canal. There is a beautiful water spout right across the hotel â€“ very good place to get your drinking water. The breakfast was very good. The hotel staff is excellent â€“ special mention for Tommasco â€“ a very friendly Italian guy- who kept our luggage even after we checked out from the hotel. In all a very decent hotel in an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Don't hesitate to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: PopeBiff
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Great service, location, and tasty breakfast. Rooms are spacious, clean, and elegant. Washroom was big and well-appointed. A/C works well. Staff was friendly and happy to speak English--just make an attempt to speak some Italian--buongiorno. It's located on a quiet, small, beautiful piazza down a well-used alley steps from the busy Grand Canal. All the best sites and charm are at your feet. To get there, your vaparetto boat (bus) stop is San Zaccaria Jolanda--important to know when you arrive in town. I wish I could remember his name but the concierge helped me greatly when he recommended a good travel agent nearby. Don't hesitate to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location = Good; Hotel = Average”
Reviews.Author: littletraveller85
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights, the room was clean and of a good size, with a nice sized, fully fitted bathroom. The location of this hotel is great, just a couple of minutes walk to San Marco Square, and from San Zaccaria Vaporetto (the water bus stop). It is just off the main walk path along the Grand Canal. The drawbacks to this hotel is the paper thin walls... you can literally hear everything, from curtains opening and closing to the showers in other rooms. This is fine if you are a heavy sleeper, but if you are a light sleeper like me I would suggest ear plugs or an alternative hotel. The breakfast isn't really a proper Italian breakfast, very little choice. I only visited once because it wasn't too appealing. The other drawback, which I found slightly disconcerting as a solo female traveller, was there is no security guard or staff at the reception desk past 8pm. The staff are relatively friendly, not the best, but then Venice is a tourist hotspot. On the whole, if you are OK with the drawbacks, then this is a good hotel, with a perfect location and not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location & Good Value”
Reviews.Author: NewieTraveller
Reviews.Content: After a train ride over night from Paris, we arrived at the main Stanzione to the hustle & bussle of Venice. On to the water taxi out onto the Grand Canal and we soon arrived at San Zaccaria Vaporetto station on the Riva degli Schiavoni. A short walk along enter a small street and the quiet campo San Zaccaria with it church opened up to us to reveal the Villa Igea. This was our first trip to Venice, a place I have wanted to visit since I was a young lad. The hotel was excellent, we had a quite a large room with two doors that opened up onto a view behind hotel, good size bathroom, the staff where excellent very helpful and spoke good english and didn't laugh at our mispronounced attempt at italian. We stayed for 5 nights, the breakfast was plentiful and very good. Location wise, the Villa Igea is fantastic. Walk out of the hotel front door turn right a short walk up the passageway leads you back onto the famous Riva degli Schiavoni, turn right and stroll along this famous waterfront to Doges Palace, Piazza San Marco and the beautiful Bascillica San Marco and shops cafes etc. Turn left out of the front doors of Villa Igea and you'll find a nice little wine bar, and other shops, turn left into street at end of campo and lots of resturants and cafes open up to you. The hotel is away from the noisy and busy San Marco Piazza but only a 5 to 8 minute walk (depending on crowds). based on ourexperience we would definetly stay here again, wouldn't hesitate to book. We have recommmednded the hotel to friends travelling to Venice and recommend it to you.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Heart in Venice, away from the crowds!”
Reviews.Author: beuns1
Reviews.Content: If you get the Vaporetto (city ferry) from the airport and get off at San Zaccaria the hotel is perfectly located in Campo San Zaccaria, this is opposite the Vaporetto stop down a short Sotoportego (passageway) or Calli (Street). Campo San Zaccaria is quiet enough to forget just how close you are to the hustle and bustle of the waterfront and of course Piazza San Marco, Basillica di San Marco, the Bridge of Sighs and the Ducale Palace, all of which are a very short walk away. The Hotel itself is very charming with very friendly staff who where especially impresed when we tried to speak a little Italian, (this worked all over the city, a must if you fancy fantastic service and not just great service) don't worry though if you are not brave enough to try all of the staff spoke very good English.
