The room we had was perfect for our needs, clean and compact with traditional Italian decor, maybe a little too small if you have large suitcases, but in our case we travelled light so this wasn't an issue for us. The bathroom was spacious and again very clean. The view from our window was of a small passageway leading to a canal, that was just out of sight due to a low wall, but every now and again you could glimpse a gondolla passing by. Breakfast was included in the price and was very nice, with a selection of cooked meets, cold meats and cheese, fruit, cereal, bread, toast, and pastry and of course, coffee, orange juice and milk. Over all the hotel was perfect for our needs and I wouldn't hessitate to stay there again if I was to revisit Venice. In Summary, a good price, perfectly located to some of the main attractions but quiet enough to forget how close you actually are, highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: biesy
Reviews.Content: Just off the Grand Canal and close to St Marks Square this was a great location. The were extremely pleasant and helpful. We had a twin room which was roomy and clean. In a lovely area with plenty of restaurants and access to water taxis. Big variety for breakfast and they arranged transport to the train station so we didn't have to lug suitcases in and out of the taxi. Beautiful church opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MarigoldToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. Good central location. Our travelling companions had no air conditioning on the 7th floor which was definitely uncomfortable. One thing to remember is if you have lots of luggage and are heading to the airport it can be a bit of a hassle with the water taxis. Water taxi to the airport from this hotel was 100 Euro's but it you get there in under 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel and easy to reach by vaporetto”
Reviews.Author: Mary081
Reviews.Content: Ideal situation. 50 yds from San Zaccaria vaporetto stop from which you can reach the airport, the grand canal , Murano and most of the lagoon islands. A real consideration when you are carrying luggage. 10 mins to San Marco and easy walking to several quieter areas of Venice. Lots of little restaurants, bars and cafes just round the corner and all good though quite expensive. Room was small but nice view of the Piazza and bathroom was modern and spotless. Breakfast was pretty good with reasonable choice. Staff very friendly and helpful. Complimentary trip to Murano included . Would undoubtedly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel, a little quirky, but quirky in a good way!”
Reviews.Author: Chicktastic
Reviews.Content: A gem in the heart of Venice. Couldn't ask for a better location. This boutique Hotel is amazing, and great value (relative to other big hotel chains with no character). I emailed in advance to ask for a room with a view and got upgrade (free of charge) to the penthouse apartment!! The staff were lovely. The hotel is really cute, old school Italian, but in a good way!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, cannot fault it”
Reviews.Author: chrishomeEngland
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the strength of previous TripAdvisor reviews and were not dissapointed. Situated in a quiet square opposite a lovely church (do go in and have a look!) just off the main water-front and within just a few minutes of St Marks Square. Very, very clean, lovely rooms (a little small perhaps but a very minor niggle since there's actually enough room to relax and you don't spend too much time in the room anyway). Fantastic breakfast and the restuarant at the sister hotel around the corner serves lovely food and all the staff are very friendly. The hotel is just 1min from a major waterbus stop (San Zaccaria) which is also brilliant. We'd agree with every other good review of this hotel, a diamond of a find.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Piazza In the Middle of Venice”
Reviews.Author: AnAmericanAbroad
Reviews.Content: For my fourth stay in Venice I wanted to be closer to Piazza San Marco since we were traveling with family and had a heavy sightseeing schedule. Availability, price, and location led us to Villa Igea in St. Zaccaria. The location was perfect - less than a 5 minute walk to Doge Palace, Campanile, and St. Mark's Basilica. Plus, Zaccaria is a vaporetto stop, so traveling to other parts of Venice, the airport, train station, and outer islands is easy. The service was good (although I prefer the personal touch of smaller, family owned inns), the breakfast was substantial, and the hotel quiet. My only complaint is that the air conditioning wasn't on, so the rooms were a little stuffy; but it is a very good value and overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff. Great location. Would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth042009
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Great location very close to San Marco Square. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location near San Marco”
Reviews.Author: john_petrush
Reviews.Content: A great central spot from which to explore Venice, and to enjoy "down time".

Reviews.Title: “i loved this hotel, gorgeous rooms, great breakfast, good location”
Reviews.Author: williamswestaus
Reviews.Content: we loved this hotel. i was concerned about venice accomodation being a bit damp and old. the staff are very friendly and helpful. the breakfast is great. the location is at the end of the grand canal, not on the canal but just behind it, so it is very quiet and not so touristy. the rooms are all decorated in venitian decor, wallpaper, tapestry curtains and matching bedspreads and painted doors with little birds on them. it made our stay feel very luxurious and romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Londoner77
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Igea is a few moments from the water at San Zaccaria, where all the boats stop, and three minutes from St Mark's square. The room and bed were really comfortable, the bathroom was clean and the shower was powerful. Breakfast was included, although we had to go to the sister hotel, the Yolanda and Savoia, for this as the Igea's coffe machine had broken down. However, it was only 30 seconds away and there was a great choice of breakfast buffet. The staff on the desk at the Igea were helpful though not obtrusive. We'd stay there again. I recommend January to go to Venice- no crowds, although a number of restaurants were shut for the holidays - and we were lucky with the weather - a bit of snow, about an hour of rain and a lot of days of sunshine. it was freezing though, so take lots of layers if you go at this time of year!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: NWyse
Reviews.Content: My wife and two children stayed in Hotel Villa Igea for four nights from 26th December 2008. We could not recommend this hotel highly enough. The location is ideal: a 30 second walk from the San Zacarria stop which you can reach directly by water bus from the airport; and only 5 minutes walk from St. Marks square. The little square in which the hotel is situated is very quiet. We were offered either a double and twin room or a suite; the suite (room 705) was very comfortable and warm, clean and decorated in the Venitian style. The staff were warm and friendly, particularly Thomas the consierge who organised a free trip to Murano for us, and also arranged a guided walking tour. The breakfast was full of choice. The price of the package which we took through Expedia was real value for money. The only thing to be aware of in Venice is the price of everything and with the pound / euro rate at the moment, money seemed to flow out of our pockets faster than the Venice tide. But Hotel Villa Igea is an absolute gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: doublearon00
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Hotel Villa Igea for four nights. It was during the dreadful storms that lasted our entire stay. However, the hotel was great. We ad a problem with the air conditioning. It stayed very warm in our room. The service is absolutely terrific. Everyone was quite helpful with offering good places to shop what to do for dinner. The television in the room only offers a couple of English channels. Mainly consisting off CNN International and BBC News. The location is quite close to St. Mark's Square. I do suggest as soon as arriving finding some rubber waders to wear. The first evening I had to carry my girlfriend on my back through the entire square as the ramps are not entirely complete as far as avoiding the flooded areas. The hotel map is not very useful. Many roads are not labeled and tend to lead off into nowhere. Given the price, it was very reasonable for a hotel in Italy. Our stay in Venice was plagued by both the rain and being very cold. However, the hotel and it's staff made the best of it.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - quality hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugNZ78
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 5 nights with my husband at this lovely hotel. The location is excellent - you can catch a water bus from the airport to the San Zaccaria stop which is literally a 2 minute walk from the hotel! The hotel is situated up a quiet alleyway opposite an historic church - San Zaccaria. The setting is excellent as only a few minute walk leads you to the busy bustling St Marks area but you have the peace and quiet of being off the main way. From the moment we arrived we were wowed by the first class service and hospitality we received from everyone from front desk to the kitchen staff. We asked several questions of the front desk staff with regards to sightseeing and each time they were incredibly helpful and would go out of their way to ensure we received the right information. We had a standard double room which was incredibly clean and well appointed with great pressure shower and tasteful decor. The bed was a little firm but perfectly acceptable and not uncomfortable. Each day we had a fabulous full breakfast with hot bacon, sausage, egg and a full range of continental choices like yoghurt, cereals and bread! I would certainly recommend this hotel again and I hope to come back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LovesToTravelAround
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay at the Villa Igea hotel. This hotel is in a great location - less than 5 minutes to Saint Marks Square and not far from the Rialto Bridge. Very close to the water taxi. The people that work here are very polite, friendly and helpful. The hotel breakfast is a great way to start your day. Room was nice and clean. Great restaurants around hotel. Venice is a beautiful place to visit and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: mcshan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Villa Igea during a photography workshop I was taking in Venice (our whole group stayed there). I was a bit confused by the posh hotel in front, but while Villa Igea was a 3 star it was very comfortable. I was sharing a room with a friend, which made things a little tight, but it wasn't like we were doing anything else in our room besides sleeping. The bathroom was huge and the shower was great. The location is fantastic - located within walking distance of the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop and across the way from a lovely church. However, walk 5 minutes and you are at San Marco square. There are tons of restaurants within walking distance, but if you walk a little further away from San Marco you can find some that are definitely not catering to tourists. The staff at Villa Igea are just wonderful. They were happy to answer questions and when I had to call the US because I lost my bank card they offered me their phone. Lastly, they have a great breakfast in the morning - should you choose this option. I happily had my doppio macchiato every morning and the women pretty much had my order down after a few days. They have a lovely choice of cereals, pastries, fruit etc. I would definitely stay at Villa Igea again. One last piece of advice: travelling in Venice in October was so nice. The weather was beautiful and even though there were still tons of tourists the season was winding down. I can't imagine what it's like in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Entente-cordiale
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend suprised me with this hotel for a romantic weekend in Venice for our anniversary earlier this year. What a treat! It was just perfect: just behind St Mark's square, but on a quiet square so not noisy at all, opposite a very pretty church, just next to the Canale. The room felt very luxurious, beautiful details, nice bathroom, and was the perfect size for a couple. Breakfast was very acceptable, and staff helpful. It will definitely remain a very fond memory.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Comfortable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Whisked_Away_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, the hotel was the best of four we stayed in during our trip to Italy, and the room was comfortable. The bathroom was a good size and nice and clean! We were a bit surprised when we arrived late at night to find that there was no-one at the front counter. We rang the buzzer and a staff member from their sister hotel came down the alley way, and started to take us to a different location!! We didn't know what we had gotten ourselves in to, until we found that they were just checking us in. This all added to the atmosphere and it turned out that they had great service and were very friendly. Thanks Villa Igea for a wonderful stay in beautiful Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Blondie247772
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Villa Igea in Venice in August 2008. We booked a double room, but on arrival were checked into an apartment on the top floor. It was much larger than we had expected, with a separate kitchen and living room. We were on honeymoon, but I don't remember mentioning the fact when we made the booking! As well as being spacious, the rooms were clean and had a view of the church. Breakfast was good, with plenty of fruit, cereal, cakes and biscuits as well as a selection of cold cheeses and meets and some cooked items. We somehow missed out on coffee and toast and croissants one morning, as the staff didn't seem to spot us arriving. Our only slight problem was that we arrived late on the first night, after reception had closed and had to go to the sister hotel to check in. It would be useful if there was a sign in the window, alerting late arrivals that this is what they should do. We ate at the sister hotel one evening, making the most of the 20% discount. The food was excellent, if a little pricey, but being so close to St Mark's Square, we expected it would be. The location is excellent, close to the vaparetto stop at San Zaccaria and only a short walk from St Mark's Square. The staff were friendly and helpful and had a great grasp of English, meaning we had to use very little of our phrase book Italian. I'd definitely stay in the hotel again were I to return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Greystonesgirl
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my stay in Venice and I'm sad to be home. I stayed in Villa Igea for 3 nights and it was perfect. I was a single girl staying and I got a good rate. I ended up with a double room and was able to check in at 11 am, which was great. The room and bathroom were a little on the small side but to be honest I was hardly there, as there is so much to see in Venice!! The hotel was spottless and the breakfast very good. I chose the hotel as I wasn't looking for somewhere fancy but I have to say it was much better than I expected. When I was looking at the photos I thought it looked a little tired and worn but it wasn't at all. The best part for me though was the location, it's a 2 minute walk off the water bus and the stop has links to most of the main attractions. It is a 2 min walk from St. Marks square too!!

Reviews.Title: “5 stars for the price of 3”
Reviews.Author: Peginas
Reviews.Content: We stayed two adults with 2 girls for one night. The hotel staff told us by e-mail that the room would be small, but we accepted the offer anyway. The hotel was difficult to find and the outside facade was a bit dissappointing. But once we got in, we found the cleanliness, the service and the room of a 5 star hotel. The hotel staff was extremely helpful, the room was very big (the hotel staff told us that they upgraded our room), and the breakfast was excellent, with even small balls of mozarella. I believe that this hotel is the exception for Venice and I would highly recommend it to anyone. Also, the location (once you find it) is excellent. Thanks to Hotel Villa Igea for this beautiful day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: yorkshirehaggis
Reviews.Content: Three years ago we stayed in the sister hotel (Savoia and Jolanda) and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We returned to Venice this year with friends but were unable to obtain two rooms of the same standard so we booked Villa Igea knowing that it was only 30m from the main hotel. We chose superior rooms, which were bright and airy, with a lovely view of the church opposite. The decor and soft furnishings were to a very high standard, however the bedroom curtains could have been somewhat heavier as they did not block out the early morning sun. The staff were all friendly and welcoming and were happy to give advice. The breakfast was excellent and set us up for the day. The only reason that this hotel is 3star instead of 4star is probably due to the lack of bar/ restaurant. In Venice this isn't a problem due to numerous restaurants nearby. The location of Villa Igea is perfect for sightseeing and the vaporetta stop is only 50m away.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and good value”
Reviews.Author: MorganP
Reviews.Content: we are just back after spending 4days in the hotel. It lived up to what other reviewers have written.We opted for a superior room overlooking the square and we very happy with the room though the top floor unlike the others did not have a balcony.The room was kept spotless and had everything you would have wanted.Breakfast was good .The only jarring note for me was that the 2 waitresses reminded me of prison warders making sure that guests did not go off with fruit or bread for their lunch. On one morning a waitress was rude to an American couple who were going off with 2 apples.They were rudely told in a loud voice that the food was for the breakfast only. Reception staff were helpful though.Overall a nice hotel in an excellent location.We went to the opera at la Fenice one night.It was a great experience but if I was going back I would have worn a shirt and tie-dress was generally formal.We also went to a Vivaldi evening advertised in the hotel lobby and it was excellent.Regarding eating out Venice is very expensive.The Trattoria alla Madonna is under the same management as the hotel and will give you a reduction of 10%.Make sure you notify them before the meal and check that the 10% is taken off the bill.It's a very busy place-there are no reservations and you need to be there before 7-00 to get a place.It's nice but pricey and they add 12 and a half % to the bill. We eat twice in a small restaurant off the square at Santa Maria Formosa for 17 euros 50 which included service and a quarter of litre of wine-excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: SouthernBrit
Reviews.Content: I spent hours on the internet looking for an hotel in Venice which was not cripplingly expensive, had a central location and got good reviews on Trip Advisor. The recent reviews on Villa Igea were all good and our stay lived up to expectations. We were there for 4 days from 8th April 08. The room we had (611) was small but it was a standard room so I wasn't expecting too much. It was spotlessly clean and being so small, presented the staff with a daily challenge with our stuff being in heaps on the floor. They managed magnificently and returning every afternoon, the room was clean,tidy and the bathroom was immaculate. Breakfast was excellent -- very varied with 3 choices of cereal, yoghurt, fresh fruit salad, fresh fruits, cheese, cold cuts, breads, scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, bacon, sausage.... The only slight downside is that the breakfast room is a bit small and one morning we had to wait about 10 minutes for a table. The location is superb as other reviewers have described. There is a snag to this though. We had terrible weather -- rain and cold most of the time, and there wasn't the incentive to roam far afield in the evening for somewhere to eat. The result was that if we chose to eat close by, then we had to pay St Marks area prices. The Igea's sister hotel (Savoia and Jolanda) gives Igea guests 20% discount but it still cost us EUR 46 for 2 pastas, 1 dessert, 2 coffees and a (small) bottle of water! All in all, I would really recommend this hotel -- very clean, good location, excellent staff, good breakfast. What else do you need for a short break?

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Lyntofari
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 703, charming old world style. Great view of the square. Staff were excellent. Breakfast, same as they were having in the sister hotel Savoia & Jolanda, which was varied and plentiful. Location, couldn't be faulted. Went with two older friends who have stayed at both hotels many times over the last 50 years. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Lilmismayhem
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviews this is a great location if you only have a short time and want to be close to the main sights. Water taxi from the airport drops you off about 200m away. Walking through a small passageway into a quiet square and there was the hotel. The Doge's palace, bridge of sighs, basilica and st marks square are all within 5 minutes walk. There are also water bus stops within 20 seconds walk which take you everywhere, including the airport. We had a room on the top floor which was a corner with four windows looking over the square. Decor was fine, as was the bathroom but the curtains do not shut the whole way. Luckily shutters block out most of the sunlight and the church bells only ring once at night (midnight). On a lower floor you may get noise from the walking tours that start coming through the square about 8-9am, we could hear the woman talking through her microphone. The breakfast is great if you like your cereal, pastries, fruit and toast. Cappuccino coffee was pretty cold though every day.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Emmy44
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this wonderful hotel in Feb 2008, and we could not have hoped for a better hotel!!! The location was AMAZING!!!. Less then a minute walk to the Grand Canal, just through a small passageway right to the front, a few seconds more to the Bridge of Sighs, and then on to St Marks Square!!. All in all we were right next to all the most amazing sights in less then two minutes of walking. There was also a water bus stop, again less then two minutes away, so getting anywhere was just so easy!. Hotel was spotless!!! The maid(s) did a fantastic job!!!. Our room was cleaned each day to an excellent standard, it was like walking into a new room each day, even with our complimentary toiletries topped up aswell!. There was a good choice of food for breakfast which was always fresh, and again, couldn't ask for anything more!. Before we booked we checked out some pictures of the hotel from this site and the hotels, and we thought that the rooms looked small, and the decor dated, don't be put off by that!!! Its totally mis-leading!. All the decor was new, and our room was not at all small, we even had a balcony and two doors off our room leading onto it!. Bathroom was also modern big. A wonderful hotel, in a perfect location, and when we return to Venice we will definately be staying at this hotel again, as anywhere else would be a disappointment!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Jorma
Reviews.Content: A nice small hotel on a small square. Very near the San Marco church and at the walking distance from most of the interesting places of Venice. Good atmosphere and friendly personnell.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rob020
Reviews.Content: Perfect location with fantastic staff. A gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in everty way!”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover1112
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic stay! Villa Igea's location is perfect! About 200m from water taxi or 'water bus' and about 5 min walk to St Mark's. The staff were very friendly and professional and spoke good english. On arrival we were upgraded to a suite which beautifully decorated in Venician style with antique furniture. We also recieved a complimentary trip in a water taxi to the island of Murano. Breakfast was also wonderful. Venice was a real surprise. People were very friendly and welcoming and really catered to their tourists. I definately recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A second wonderful visit”
Reviews.Author: MaryVLondon
Reviews.Content: I first visited the Villa Igea in september with my two elderly Aunts. I initially chose the Igea because of accessibility to major sights and it had an elevator. The hotel exceeded our expectations and made this once in a lifetime trip for them perfect. The manager, Mr Ometto and his staff are charming and helpful and always took time to talk to my aunts. I returned in november with my husband and again chose the Igea. The rooms are pretty and cosy and some overlook the church square of san zacceria. The location is perfect and very near the airport vaporetto stop which makes the initial arrival by water into venice with luggage very easy. I will be returning to the villa Igea again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a real pleasure”
Reviews.Author: PJ100
Reviews.Content: Ahh! How the pleasurable memories of Villa Igea linger. Perfect location, 2 minutes from St Marks and 200 metres from the Grand Canal, on a quiet piazza. Staff could not be more helpful or friendly and the room, admittedly an upgrade, was roomy and elegant with a view over the piazza. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good location and efficient”
Reviews.Author: DoctorM
Reviews.Content: Hotel Igea is a small and efficient hotel in a great location. Our room was small, even by Venetian standards and you can expect two people to bump into each other while getting dressed. However, the view onto the quiet Campo San Zaccaria is beautiful. You will hear churchbells every morning and nothing but voices and footsteps in the evenings. The vaporetto stop is about 100meters away and you are a short walk from San Marco. The front desk staff are multi-lingual, helpful, but formal. The breakfast area is too small for the hotel and not particularly attractive. You can expect breakfast to be crowded and the wait-staff to be pressed for time. Breakfast is modest with a few choices of cold cuts, pastries, a couple of hot dishes, and fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, immaculate, vey romantic”
Reviews.Author: sukeypoo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very romantic few days in venice Had a difficult journey to get there as Italian air traffic controllers went on a lightening strike so finally arrived 12 hours late, but it was worth it. On arrival we had been given a bottleof champagne in our room to make up for the delay which was greatly appreciated. The staff were so friendly and helpfull at all times. Villa Igea is in a perect location just 5 mins from St Marks and 30 secs from the water bus stop. I would really recommend this hotel and look forward to visiting again. But take loads of money as everything is sooooooooooo expensive

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10!”
Reviews.Author: BMac3009
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long weekend trip to Venice with my Mum. We stayed at the Villa Igea and had a brilliant time. The hotel is situated about 50 metres from the San Zaccaria water bus stop through a small alley way. I actually got the directions from another review of this hotel on Trip Advisor.The staff were really helpful and friendly. We wanted to watch the rugby world cup final and they found us a pub that was showing the game! Our room was nicely decorated and comfortable. The bathroom was spotless and the shower was powerful and very large! We booked our flight and the hotel through Expedia and got an amazingly competitive price. I would definitely recommend this hotel and am very surprised that it was only a three star. It is great value for money. Breakfast is a buffet which is included on a B&B basis and although the dining room is relatively small we never had to wait to be seated. Although dinner isn't served at the hotel we would recommend the Trattoria Rivetta which has a great atmosphere and is good value for money. You need to turn left out of the hotel and then take the left in the corner of the square. The restaurant is straight ahead on the left just over the bridge. However, it is very popular so you might have to wait for a table. When we were there we were offered a glass of wine and some snacks whilst we waited! All in all we had a great time. Definitely book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: catlover202
Reviews.Content: I would defintiely recommend Villa Igea. The location was great. Near St. Marks but in a quiet campo across from a beautiful church. The room was a reasonable size for Venice, and was nice and clean (with the exception of the carpet which could use a professional cleaning). The manager Tomasso was very sweet and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: veggietraveller
Reviews.Content: Returned this week from a six night stay at Villa Igea. I had booked it because we couldn't book the hotel we had stayed in previously and couldn't have made a better choice. The location is perfect. I don't want to repeat the comments of other visitors to the hotel but I liked the very Venetian decor and the fabric covered walls. We were given a small suite of a double room, single room and en suite. The wardrobe space was in the single room which we used as a dressingroom. This could have been difficult if three adults had actually been using the rooms as there was no storage in the double room but we were very comfortable. We also had no view as our room overlooked an alley at the rear of the building but we didn't mind that. Some visitors might not be happy with the church bells regularly pealing but I loved it and, although I don't usually sleep well, I had no problem and slept soundly. I liked the fresh bed linen every day. Staff were very pleasant , friendly and efficient. Breakfast was to my taste. I am vegetarian and had an excellent choice. Venice was as beautiful as ever and I hope to go back to Villa Igea again. Go to Zattere and have gelato at Nico's while watching the huge cruise ships go past. Just around the corner you will see a very old gondola yard which I first read about in Marlena de Blasi's book 'A Thousand Days in Venice'. She also frequented Nico's for gelato. Don't just visit the museums and churches - go on the audio tour of the Theatre La Fenice. I thought I had seen just about everything Venice could amaze me with until I saw the auditorium in the theatre. We ended every evening, wandering in Piazza San Marco listening to the music. If you are reading this and about to go to Venice for the first time, I envy you. There is nothing to compare with the first visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near san marco but away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: FrequentPoipuVisitor
Reviews.Content: We booked our family into four rooms in Hotel Villa Igea where had a great stay. The Villa's location is ideal being in Piazza San Zaccaria, a quiet piazza across from its incredible church (be sure to view the interior). It is close to but isolated from Piazza San Marco and the bustling crowds. Three of the rooms were standards yet nicer than most standards and one was superior. The latter had a small sitting room and very private balcony -deck overlooking the piazza. There are also balconies available to all guests great for evening wine and snacks. The rooms were well decorated, clean, comfortable and quiet. The Villa Igea's staff and management were superb, friendly, knowledgeable and very accommodating. The breakfast was also very good with many choices. There is a lift or elevator, an especially helpful feature for some. We've been to Venice several times and this has been the best hotel so far. The Hotel Villa Igea is accessed via vaporetto (water bus) numbers 1, 41, and 51. Whatever vaporetto you take get off at the San Zaccaria vaporetto landing then proceed straight across the busy quay and through an arch into Piazza San Zaccaria (the arch also indicates the direction to "Ospedale San Giovanni e San Paolo". The hotel is about 25 yards further on the left opposite the church. If you arrive in Venice during rush hour consider taking a vaporetto (#51?) instead of # 1. Choose one that does not stop at every dock along the Grand Canal (very picturesque) but instead goes around the island with fewer stops

Reviews.Title: “a perfect place in venice”
Reviews.Author: dinadavid
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 25th anniversary vacation in Italy 4 nights in Rome and 4 nights in Venice. We found Villa Igea on this web site and based on the reveiws here felt it would be a safe choice. In fact it was a GREAT choice! The location is fantastic - steps away from San Marco, but without the hordes of tourists and the noise, next to a main vaporetto (boat/bus) stop that enables you to come and go virtually everywhere. The hotel is on a small piazza facing San Zaccaria Church, with its own water fountain (be sure to have an empty bottle to fill). The hotel is in a small building dating from 1875, small, intimate and very clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful, especially the manager - Leonardo - who mans the front desk most of the day. They gave us royal treatment when they learnt it was our anniversary, and did everything to make sure our stay was really good, including reserving tickets for us to a Vivaldi concert and to a Jazz performance. On the last day we had to leave the hotel before 4am. Leonardo arranged a wake up call, without us asking, as he was concerned we should't miss the boat to the airport, and had 2 breakfast bags waiting for us with the night porter. We don't usualy write in this web site, but really wanted to commend Leonardo and his team and recommend this lovely hotel to all other users. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fair accomodations”
Reviews.Author: FLMWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: Hotel Igea in Venice is a small, well located pensione not far from St. Mark's Square. The rooms are quite small, as are the bathrooms, and I found the management's automatic currency conversion (euros to dollars) at time of early morning checkout a bit sneaky and self-serving. Access to vaporetti is excellent, including water bus to airport and maritime terminal. Location on a small, charming and quiet square (Campo San Zaccaria) very close to the Grand Canal is appealing. The breakfast is ample and tasty. The small rooms are not cheap at $331 for a cramped double.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Claire166
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the review on this site and were not dissapointed. The location is PEFECT and the staff are friendly and helpful. The room was beautiful, if a little small, but we had a balcony which overlooked the charming square and San Zaccaria church. The Vaparetto stop is a 1 minute walk from the hotel, St Marks Square about 5 minutes and Rialto bridge about 15 minutes. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikejanew
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Venice, but first time staying at the Villa Igea - won't be the last though! What a delightful hotel, half a minutes walk from the waterfront and only a few more to St Mark's Square. If you catch the Aliguina from the airport (we paid 12 euros each) it takes about 1 hr 10 mins and drops you off at St Mark's Square. Turn right along the waterfront, across 2 bridges and you're there. It's in a perfect location if you want to be in central Venice - you can walk to everything from there. The hotel is in a lovely little square, opposite a church which is worth a visit, and at night, we couldn't hear a thing, it was so quiet. The reception staff cannot do enough for you, they are so helpful. The room was spotless, with everything you could need, and breakfast is buffet style, with plenty of choice. I will definitely return to the Villa Igea, no complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “cannot be beaten”
Reviews.Author: josephine-public
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is perfect. If you get the right water bus from the airport, it is just a few level steps to the door. If you collapse into the cool air of the Jolanda reception, the staff will take your luggage the few steps more to The Igea. Almost free cashing of travellers cheques at reception at Jolanda. Discount on food and drinks in Jolanda with the advantage of a ring-side seat to people watch along the frontage of The Grand Canal. Quaint, and very loud church bells which ring just once, at 6pm. Quite handy as an alarm clock for the evening. Beautiful Venetian decor in our room overlooking the square.. OK, Venice in July is hot, crowded, and the mess that we tourists create can smell a little. It is expensive. Finding a decent meal for a decent price can be challenging. Who cares? This is the most beautiful city in the world, and for the price, this is simply the best place to stay. I took my daughter for a 5 night stay to celebrate her 18th. We never once felt threatened or concerned in any way as female travellers. We walked back every night along the narrowest, darkest alleys and I never would at home!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: UKVeniceFan
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews on Trip Advisor we booked this hotel for a week as it seemed ideal for our needs and it lived up to all our expectations. It is in a pretty square within 200 metres of Piazza San Marco and very close to Vaporetti stops giving access to all parts of Venice and the islands. Staff could not have been more friendly and helpful, breakfast fresh and plentiful, room clean and furnished beautifully with all we needed. We did upgrade to one of their best room which was on the top floor with lovely views of the church and roof gardens. Do not miss going into the church in the square - especially the chapel and waterlogged crypt for 1â‚¬.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel horrible city”
Reviews.Author: Hogold
Reviews.Content: My wife and 21 year old daughter stayed here in June. Getting to the hotel with luggage was very difficult as the water taxi that day dropped us off a stop before the hotel. Lugging four suitcases about five blocks in the summer heat through the crowds was a real treat. We were upgrade to an apartment which was very large and required walking up a flight of steps from the elevator. Room was clean and AC worked well. Biggest problem was the lobby closes at around 7 each night and the hotel in front of Villa Igea takes the calls and request for wake up calls. We did not get our wake up call our last day and with jet lag slept to late and nearly missed our train to Florence. No one seemed to care about this and they would not pay for a water taxi (the water bus takes about 40 minitues to get to the train) to get us to the train. The hotel was OK, overpriced but everything in Venice is. Be prepared to pay $7 for a coke, $6 for a cappucino, $25 a person for pasta at lunch. Venice was wall to wall people in June and not sure why. Once you had seen the canals and maybe the castle there is not much else to do, unless you want to walk into about 200 shops selling clay mask. Almost everyone we spoke to during our two weeks in Italy agreed that Venice was the low point of their trip. Unless you really must see the canals spend you time and money in Florence, Pisa, Rome, or better yet Tuscany.

Reviews.Title: “Villa Igea Delivers Again”
Reviews.Author: marinablue
Reviews.Content: The week before Easter 2007, I returned to the Villa Igea for the third time in two years and it continues to charm me. It is always my first choice for Venice and I have already rebooked for another stay there this coming December. It is a real bargain out of season. The rooms are appointed with typical Venetian furnishings and decor and have great bathrooms and I have always found them comfortable and very clean. You can forgive the odd mosqito which sometimes are quite prevalent across the whole of the Veneto area. Each time I have stayed Villa Igea, I have had a different room, with twice being located at the front and once at the back . Athough they have varied in size from small upwards, I am never disappointed. Hotel rooms in Venice, because of the great age of many of the building i.e. going back many centuries, can often seem cramped and dark unless you pay a huge fortune. But what the heck, you haven't come to Venice to stay 24hours a day in a hotel room. The Villa Igea is so convenient to find on arriving from the airport. Take the Aliaguna direct to San Zaccaria and the hotel is less than 30 seconds away. During my first two visits, guests of the Igea took their breakfast at its larger sister hotel Savoie and Jolanda facing the lagoon and bacino with marvellous views across to San Giorgio Maggiore. So although the quality of the breakfast is the same, it is perhaps now a little disappointing to take it in a little room at the back of the Igea. But I would say that the service is better than at the S & J. If you are staying for 24 hours or more, I recommend you buy a Orange VeniceCard at the Vela window at the airport (to the left in the arrival hall). Although initally this will seem expensive, it is not when compared with buying ad hoc vaporetti tickets, museum, Doges Palace and art gallery admission, entry to public toilets etc. You also get discounts in some shops and restaurants. (NB the public toilets in Venice are very well maintained and clean but cost a euro to get in if you don't have a VeniceCard) Eating in Venice is expensive and not always value for money, but if you get a no 82 Vaporetti from San Zaccaria and get off at the Zatterre on the Giudecca Canal (about 10 mins away) you will find some nicer and cheaper restaurants with floating pontoons and great views away from the crowds that congregate along San Marco and the Riva Degli Schiavoni. Also if you get off at the Zattere stop and walk straight down the Rio beside the Gesuati church within a minute you are at the Accademia Bridge and the Grand Canal. This can be useful as the 82 Boat is often far less crowded than the No 1 that goes from San Zaccaria to the Accademia down the Grand Canal. Along the Zattere just past the Gesualti going West, is a great ice cream parlour called Nico. Three fairly large scoops of real, mouth watering ice cream cost 2.20 euros, which is very reasonable given the quality of it.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: expertreviews
Reviews.Content: Not a way to spend your European Vacation...spring the extra bucks for a 4 star. We stayed 3 nights around Easter time, which after Easter it was pretty empty. Our first night was miserable. Our room was so small we could barely walk around in our room. There were cigarette holes on our bed, dead bugs on the ceilings and nats/bugs flying in my ear while trying to sleep that night. When we complained to the front desk, they said they couldn't do anything about it. Eventually I fought with them enough that they upgraded us to a suite we could actually fit in. It was cleaner (no bugs that I saw), but still dated with furnishings. Bottom line, maybe it is a good "bang for your buck", but you already are spending so much money to get to Venice...kvie a little. The location is good, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PLK101
Reviews.Content: A mistake was made with our original reservation to another hotel. We found the Villa Igea at the last minute on Expedia, and it far exceeded our expectations. It was a little hard to find at first but in an excellent location, very near many restaurants and 5 star hotels. It was very clean, staff was very helpful and a fine experience overall. I would highly recommend it and if we return to Venice, we would definitely stay here again. It was family firendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dudley UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 0n 26th June 2007 for three nights.We had flown from Rome into Treviso Airport with Ryan Air. At Treviso there is a ATVO bus service which coincides with the arrival of Ryan Air flights. You can purchases the bus tickets and also water bus tickets in the terminal. The water bus drops you off at San Zaccaria which is right opposite the Savoia&Jolanda Hotel.The entrance to Villa Igea is along the alley to the right. If checking in after 7pm like us you have to go the reception at the Savoia. We were allocated room 612 which was at the rear with not much of a view. The room itself was quite small but everything was very clean and it had all the required amenities. The breakfast room is again small but the food on offer was quite good. There is no bar or restaurant but you get a 20% discount on food at the sister hotel. It is also very pleasant sitting outside the front of the Savoia at night having a few drinks watching all the day trippers scrambling onto the water buses. The Hotel is in a great location near the waterfront and only minutes from the Doges Palace and St Marks. Most things are walkable from here. All in all its a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, quiet and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: merseygirlUk
Reviews.Content: A very convenient hotel just near st marks square. Very clean. Nice room, small but nice shower room. The hotel is convient for the vaporetto and near St Marks Sq. If flying in by Ryanair get the vaporetto from the bus stop where they drop you off to Zaccaria. which is the stop just next to St Marks Sq stop. Get a ticket for the whole of your stay as it is cheaper than getting single tickets. Also get the ticket for the shuttle bus from the airport before getting on the bus or they will chuck you off and your luggage and tell you to get the next bus. Staff at the Igea are very helpful and even checked where we were to go to to pick up our cruise ship as our travel agent had given us the wrong information which hotel staff had queried. We had a room at the back but it was fine and overlooked some quaint little back alleys. The breakfast was continental and some cooked items in a small clean room at the back of the hotel.There was a small roof terrace which we did not have time to use as we were there only one evening and one morning. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good small hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine101Surrey
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel with limited reception service - I think 8 - 8 that offers good value for money compared to other much pricier options in an expensive city. The location was fantastic just round the corner from St Marks Square and 1 min walk to one of the main water bus stops which made getting to and from the airport very easy. The rooms themselves were very nice and very venetian and the buffet breakfast just as good as others I've had in Italian 4 star hotels. The majority of rooms also offered a nice view over a small courtyard and a very picturesque church. If you choose to stay in any of the hotels in a central city location you need to be aware that it can be a little noisy at night though although nothing that stopped us from sleeping having walked goodness knows how many miles each day. A really nice small hotel in probably the most beautiful sity in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could move in!”
Reviews.Author: JillConnecticut
Reviews.Content: To find this special hotel, get off the vaparetto at S. Zaccaria and walk through the small alley directly in front of you (towards the carbanieri!). It is a delight! Beautifully appointed rooms, very helpful staff (they provcide you with your own small Eyewitness Guide for Venice), nice breakfast and large modern bathrooms. Our room overlooked the cathedral (costs more). Ours friends' room did not but they were equally pleased. Quiet retreat 5 minutes from all the action!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: PPJ9
Reviews.Content: It wasn't a great start when we struggled to find the hotel (it's a bit hidden away!!). However, once we did find it, it was a fantastic experience. Welcoming and friendly staff, great size room, amazing bathroom, great location. A really nice place to come back to after a day treading the streets of Venice! I could have stayed much longer than our 3 day stay, but it was a real bonus, at a reasonable price. The only thing stopping this being a higher rating is it's lack of extra facilities - but then there is plenty to keep one occupied in Venice without the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but some caveats”
Reviews.Author: JiminVA
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 had a nice stay (2 rooms, 2 nights in mid-June). This small hotel is very nice and quiet, and in a terrific central location 2 minutes from the waterfront (great for both luggage and train/airport transfers) and 4 minutes from San Marco. But a couple of caveats: (1) When I booked in Feb., the reviews raved about how guests could take breakfast at the sister hotel on the waterfront, and how you could order drinks from their bar, served on a roof terrace. Neither perk now exists: you now take breakfast only in their own breakfast room (fair but quite ordinary), and there is no hotel bar. (2) Our kids' room had a very leaky shower, which also had a bit of mildew. In sum, this is a very nice hotel, but don't depend on prior amenities that no longer apply.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Igea!”
Reviews.Author: neruda11
Reviews.Content: FANTASTIC location...quiet, yet very close to San Marco square. Large room, clean, wonderfully decorated. Helpful staff. And a pretty darn good value.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location with lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Touring
Reviews.Content: We are two couples who stayed in 2 rooms in Villa Igea. I specifically asked for rooms facing the square. We were given two lovely rooms with many windows. The location is ideal. Almost right "behind" St Mark's Square but in its own quiet little oasis (San Zaccaria). The vaporetto stop is very close by. The breakfast was good and substantial (eggs, hot pastry, bacon). The service is always friendly and attentive. The San Zaccaria church (which the hotel faces) in the square is a gem. Besides the Bellini and the Titian (and others), there is the small underground grotto that is perpetually flooded.

Reviews.Title: “Off to a Rocky Start...”
Reviews.Author: Ohnjmdva
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Friday,May 25th for one night, with another night reserved on Saturday, June 2nd. Upon arrival on the 25th, the manager said there was a problem and he did not have our room. The previous guest had to go to the hospital and so his wife wouldn't be leaving for a couple of days and our room was not available. He offered to move us to another 3 star hotel near by...a Best Western...and to upgrade us when we returned the next week. We accepted the offer, went to the Best Western, which was lovely, and had a great stay. When we returned the next week, the same manager upgraded our room to one that overlooked the courtyard and church out front. He even gave us a bottle of champagne!!! The room was beautiful. I would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located”
Reviews.Author: Weekend_getaways
Reviews.Content: A group of six friends stayed at the Villa Igea in early May. We had 4 rooms between us. The hotel is in a great location and the staff were really nice. The rooms are spotlessly clean but have to be the smallest I have ever stayed in ( I could literally touch both walls in the single room I stayed in ), however as Venice is very crowded and we only slept in the rooms, it was OK. I booked via the hotel website, and as I had a query I had to send a number of emails. The hotel always responded very quickly. The hotel also booked our restaurants for us ( I had suggested some names from the TA Forum recommendationsâ€™ ), and additionally suggested a lovely restaurant with a garden for our last lunch. There was a problem with one of the restaurants ( my fault - we went to the wrong one ), but the hotel were very gracious about it ( the restaurant we should have gone to, rang up and were very annoyed at our no show ). I would definitely stay at the Villa Igea again

Reviews.Title: “OK for Labor Day”
Reviews.Author: dirkv
Reviews.Content: One night stay during busy May 1st long weekend. Hotel was clean, very small room (standard double supposedly upgraded). Very convenient location 5 minutes from St Mark's; many restaurants nearby; water bus easy to get to from Santa Lucia. Hotel during thia weekend was very busy and noisy; located on a small square a minute from the Stop number 16. Breakfast was good; paid Euro 232.......I guess not bad for Venice; may or may not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShannenPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for 3 nights in May 2007 and had a wonderful time. It was our first time to Venice and we loved the city. The hotel has a great location in San Zaccaria. We were traveling by train from Tuscany and the hotel was easy to find after getting off the ferry so we didn't have to go far with all our luggage. The staff was very helpful with restaurant recommendations, setting up some tours (walking and Grand Canal boat tour) and our trip to Murano. I asked to have a room with a view so we were upgraded to the front of the hotel. Our room was very nice and clean. The location is 5 minutes from St Mark's but nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem of a hotel for the location and price”
Reviews.Author: kulie13
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel, with nice room and facilities - my only gripe is that there was no tea or coffee facilities in the room, but I don't know how common that is for Venice hotels and is a very minor point. I found the location brilliant, the hotel staff charming and helpful, and the price couldn't be beaten. A couple of tips - If you go on the trip to Murano, do it by public water bus - the hotel 'free trip' lands you straight in one particular factory with no access to the rest of the island. Also, try going up the tower at San Giorgio across the water rather than the one in St Marks Square - much less crowded, better view. I will definitely be going back to Villa Igea, and recommend it very highly.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Travellers_Two
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a wonderful stay at the Villa Igea for her 50th birthday and must say that this hotel lives up to most of the previous positive comments. The rooms were kept immaculate by the cleaners, the reception staff were most polite and helpful and the breakfast provided was more than ample, albeit in a somewhat cramped environment at the peak time of 9:00am in the mornings. We would have preferred, as those in previous reviews, to have taken breakfast on the water front at the Sister Hotel. May we offer three small tips? 1. When getting the Alilaguna line Water bus from the airport to San Zaccaria, do not queue in the airport for tickets as there's a ticket booth down at the water front with virtually no queue. 2. The small cafe to the right of the Villa Igea is very reasonable for drinks and snacks at lunch time. We paid 9 Euros for two medium beers and 2 well filled sandwiches each. 3. My wife insisted on taking a Bellini cocktail at Harry's Bar (San Marco). 1 Bennini cocktail and 1 small Coke came to 26 Euros with the service added.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Quiet and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Cyn2
Reviews.Content: We lucked out and were able to book this hotel for Easter Eve. It's in the best place possible. Quiet campo, close to St. Marks, but away from the crowds. Water transport was very handy (just a few yards away) and around the corner are wonderful restaurants and shops. The staff were very helpful, Tommasso was the only one who's name I got. But he helped us track down our lost luggage and also provided help with getting a water taxi to our cruise. Our stay was truly enjoyable and we'd highly recommend this quiet little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Villa Igea”
Reviews.Author: 2foodies
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 5 that booked a triple and double room. Rooms were on separate floors but this was not a problem as the hotel is very small. The windows in both rooms opened to an inside square that was for machines and some type of equipment, not sure what but there was a compressor or motor that ran on/off/on/off constantly. This was a bit noisy and not much ventilation from windows because of the enclosed square. We visited in April when it was already quite warm and the air was not on yet so you did need to have the windows open. Rooms, linens and bathrooms were clean and hotel was otherwise quiet. They had just started serving breakfast there and it was the norm for Italy, meat, cheese, yogurt, fruit,dry cereal, bread and drinks. The street that the hotel is on is very difficult to find, you will do best to look for the parent hotel Yolanda and Savoie across from the waterbus stop. Just to the right of the outdoor dining area is an arch that leads to the alley that leads to Villa Igea.

Reviews.Title: “what a find!”
Reviews.Author: chd
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and this hotel was actually recommended by a client..it is in an excellent location, is clean and tidy, we had fresh towels every day, the breakfast is good and the staff really friendly, I have already recommended it to two more clients and would not hesitate to send anyone here.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: skelligs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Villa Igea for 2 nights and loved it. The hotel is located in a quite street and only a few minutes walk to San Marco Square and San Zaccaria water bus stop. Our room was spacious, clean and nicely decorated. We had a lovely view of the courtyard and San Zaccaria Church. The staff was friendly and accomodating. We booked a package called "Dreaming of Venice" that included breakfast, 1 dinner for 2 at the Principesa Restaurant, a bottle of Prosecca wine and water boat tour of Murano island to visit a glass factory. All this for 110 Euro/night. Dinner at the Principesa was the best we had in Italy. Great location, nice room and good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bellboy37
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great place,only minutes from St Marks Square.We stayed for 4 nights and the bed linen and towels were changed every day,yes every day!If possible get a room at the front of the hotel overlooking the square,this totolly adds to the experience.As stated in earlier reviews,breakfast is NOT served in the hotel down the road but they now have thier own dining room.We had 2 breakfasts in the other hotel and were then informed on day 3 that they now had there own dining room.Just as good but more handy.

Reviews.Title: “A great Venetian Experience!”
Reviews.Author: mleftwich
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa Igea for three nights, selecting it based on the good reviews found here on Trip Advisor. As everyone has pointed out, this is a great small hotel very convenient to just about everything. If you are interested in booking this hotel - which I would highly recommend - I suggest using the gta hotels site. They were able to book our entire stay, despite every other travel site I visited saying there was no availability for one of the nights. They also had the best rate - at $400 for three nights, including breakfast and taxes. We had friends staying in a hotel on the Grand Canal and spending 350 Euro a night, and I have to say that the Igea was actually much nicer and much more "Venetian." You really feel like you are staying in Venice with the decor and charming square that the rooms overlook. The hotel our friends were at was just like any other standard European hotel - and far more expensive. My last bit of advice, make sure you have Euros before you arrive. We arrived at Treviso airport (used by Ryan Air) at 10:30 pm and their ATM wasn't working. You have to have cash to pay for the bus tickets into Venice (which is a 45 minute trip). We almost ended up having to rent a car, which would take a credit card, but another visitor took pity on us and loaned us the 10 Euros we needed to get the bus! We had a similar problem once we made it to the bus station and tried to get a ticket for the vaporetto, but because it was so late the next one wasn't due for another 25 minutes anyway. We actually just walked from the Bus Station to Villa Igea - about a 40 minute walk - and actually ended up arriving before some of the other visitors that waited for the vaporetto. We did find an ATM along our walk that night, but in the future I will definitely get a few Euros before we leave the UK!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: hawk21
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on recommendations and reviews on tripadvisor and I was not disappointed. Its Location is just fantastic as it is very close 3 min walk to vaporetto San Zaccaria and 5 mins from St Marks. The Hotel itself is a boutique style, very comfortable room (small) but we were lucky as attached to our double room was an extra room with single bed (room 504 )which was great to use as changing room. Room decorated with silk fabric walls, murano glass light fittings, just fab.Breakfast was at the Hotel Savoy + Yolanda just 4 doors down , breakfast was good enough buffet with fresh fruit salads, fruit, breads, ham cheese the only hot food was bacon and scrambled eggs. We ate lunch a few times in Robertos just turn left from hotel and about 3 mins on corner, coffee was good and pastas. We tried to eat at Alla Rivetta from hotel turn left over first bridge as u come to last step on bridge its on your right, this trattoria is used by locals ,but it was full , with queues waiting to be seated so never got the opportunity to eat there, mores the pity ! Carnival was on for our first 3 days , brilliant atmosphere. It was a real mardi gras with everyone dressed up, with masks etc. I must say around St Marks area at night ,even during carnival it got quiet at 11.00 pm .The two days after carnival at night it was very quiet. You can walk everywhere in Venice , its the best way to see the place. Get good map as its easy to get lost , you will find some fantastic squares, churches and cafes. Just enjoy the maze of little streets , bridges, and canals. Venice is a wonderful place to visit. Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irish-abroad-7
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a wonderful weekend in Venice. This is easily the best *** hotel I have stayed in. I asked in advance for a nice room, as it was my girlfriends birthday on the day we arrived, and I also had planned for us to get engaged while we were there. We were given room 606, which looked like something out of a fairy tale with its decor. The room was spotlessly clean, with sat TV, mini-bar, power-shower and fresh towels delivered every day of our stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and arranged a booking to a concert for us on the Saturday night. The location is unbeatable, 1 minute walk to St. Marks. The hotel was quiet and I can imagine a lot more peaceful than it's sister hotel Savoia & Jolanda, around the corner directly on San Zaccaria. Breakfast is actually served in the Savoia & Jolanda, and although basic, well prepared and very tasty. All in all, this hotel contributed immensely to a wonderful weekend in what is for me, the most special city I have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it's true, it's really this good.”
Reviews.Author: AnArt27
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Villa Igea last December and I must say it was very, very good. From what I've seen and talked to other tourists in Venice, it's probably the best place to stay due to many factors: - unbeatable location, you have the privilege of being just 5 minutes walking to San Marco, or if you will, the privilege of walking through San Marco every time you return to the hotel - the easiest access from a vaporetto stop (you take 1 minute walking from the door to the vaporetto stop, very good and important, considering most tourists have heavy luggage that is infernal to carry out in Venice, I felt really sorry for all the tourists I saw muscling out their huge luggage up and down all the bridges, totally lost trying to locate their hotel in the labyrinth that are the little streets of Venice) - prices excellent for the quality provided (I've stayed in a superior room in the top floor and I must say it is worth the money, facing the beautiful if under reform facade of San Zaccaria church, 4 windows, very spacious which is a rare thing in Venice, and the Campo San Zaccaria where the hotel is located is a surprising world of peace and beauty right next to the "hell" of thousands of tourists passing by in the main street outside the protective sottoportego) - breakfast in itself is just satisfactory (3 star ordinary breakfast in a 4 star hotel...) but the place where you eat it, Villa Igea's "mother-hotel", the over-priced 4 star Savoya Jolanda, is just amazing, either inside or even better, outside, facing San Giorgio Maggiore and the lagoon, just great and another privilege, eating breakfast every morning with one of the most amazing sceneries in the world.. - as to the staff, they are quite nice and although I speak italian I saw that they all speak english and can provide you with all the info you require. I would most definitely stay again at this hotel, that I chose precisely because of all these reviews and quite honestly, they are true, this hotel really deserves to be in the top 10.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: KZooMichigan
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for two nights. It was the best hotel of three hotels we stayed at (Paris and Rome), for a very reasonable price of USD125 per night. The staff was very friendly and directed us to the hotel when we got into Venice late at night. The room was bigger than expected, very clean and very nice and soft sheets. Bathroom was fantastic. Very good location also, but the best way to explore Venice is to walk everywhere so the location is not that important. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Venezia”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTravelin'T
Reviews.Content: Villa Igea was a beautiful gem of a hotel, and a steal for the price. It was quiet and convenient to all of the major attractions in Venice. The room was a good size, the bedding was luxurious, the bathroom spacious and well appointed. Our room had a window facing a charming courtyard with a church and a fountain. The staff was courteous, offering suggestions for dinner and other pursuits. What a find! My favorite hotel in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Liz-Mikko
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here at trip advisor we thought the Villa Igea would offer us the best value. After staying there for 3 nights I would agree everyone else that Villa Igea is a great hotel. First the positives. - Great location. Close to St. Marks to be in the middle of the action when you want to but located on a side street so that you are away from the crowds and it's quiet in the evenings. - Excellent service and very clean room. The staff at Villa Igea could not have been more accomodating. - The breakfast was the best complimentary breakfast I've had in Europe. The fruits, meats, and pastries were excellent. There was nothing negative about the hotel. The room was very small by American standards, but I knew that going there and I would have had to pay more than twice as much per night to get the extra space and the same ameminites. When I return to Venice I will definitely be staying at Villa Igea again!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault this place - phenomenal location”
Reviews.Author: ellives
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place to stay in Venice. If you are like me and you've read all of the reviews...and like me you wonder how much is true, then wonder no more. It really is a great location...it really is less than five minutes stroll to St Marks Square...yet it really is a peaceful haven, even though it is less than 30 seconds from the canal, the water bus/airport bus station and the view in the photo! One other really attractive plus point is that San Zaccaria is one of four stops made by the airport transport boat (alilaguna), so it stops literally in front of the hotel, maybe 75 metres away. 12 euros and 57 minutes later and bingo, you arrive. The photos of the room don't really do it justice. This room, 606, is a superior graded room and cost 237 euros per night. The bed is over 2 metres wide, the walls covered in a paded sillk effect paper, very luxurious! The breakfast was pleasant and really not a problem having to duck out into the street and walk the 30 seconds to the venue in the adjoining sister hotel. Sorry, I know it's not always a good strategy, but I have to make a few recommendations.... for lunch....my wife and i went here for lunch on Thursday, arrived about 1.45 and had a fabulous time; a real seafood delight, plus other exquisite food - we really enjoyed it, drank too much of the 8 euros a litre house fizz too - great fun, great food too. 60 euros for both of us - we tried lots! The location is turn left out of the Hotel, follow the street around (50 metres-ish); as you go over the bridge, you'll see it tucked away on the left hand side - Trattoria alla Rivetta. Ponte S. Provolo 4625. for masks - the best - [-]camacana[-] for art - Ca' Pesaro. International art and all up real close (surprisingly little security and some stuff without glass etc)..I'm not saying this as a potential art theif, more as someone who assumed that the work of artists like Klimt; Matisse and Kandinsky would be more secure. Hope this is of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel Near St. Mark's & Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: IntentionalTourist
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at Villa Igea (www.hotelvillaigea.it) we were greeted by Tomasso at the front desk and told that the superior double we booked was not currently available and that they were "upgrading" us to the apartment that sleeps 6. We were skeptical and he told us to look at the room and then decide. It was actually in the adjoining building but looked out over Campo San Zaccaria. The room was HUGE (probably 1,000 square feet) and had a separate sitting room with a piano, a kitchen with table, an entry hall and a washing machine (no dryer). We took the room and later saw the others we passed on and were happy with our decision. The other rooms (some which had balconies) were attractive but very small and all had carpet - which in Venice is not a benefit because of the moisture and possible mold. The hotel (3 star) was very nice and was owned by the same people who own the 4 star Savoia e Jolanda that overlooks the Grand Canal and is where you eat breakfast every morning (great view!). Because of the two hotel ownership we got a complimentary trip to the island of Murano to see how they make their famous Murano glass (very cool, but beware that you will get a sales pitch at the end to buy a chandelier). The hotel is literally less than a 2 minute walk to the Grand Canal where there is access to vaporettos, ferries, water taxis and gondolas. This is also an excellent location because it is a 5 minute walk to St. Mark's Square where much of the action is. Tomasso was very helpful at identifying and booking restaurants and his English was great. They also booked our 4 am water taxi for the morning we were leaving and a bell hop came to our room to collect our luggage and carry it to the canal at that insane hour. The room was clean (with the exception of mold on the ceiling in the bathroom) and comfortable, and it had a couple of beautiful glass chandeliers (makes me wonder if they own the chandelier glass maker we visited). I recommend this hotel to anyone, including families, going to Venice -- incidentally one of the most incredible cities I've seen in my extensive travels. By the way, the Gritti Palace terrace bar is an excellent place for a romantic sunset cocktail on the Grand Canal and a nighttime gondola ride is great after 10 pm because it is quiet and you feel all alone on the canals.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: WSG34
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel that's close to St. Mark's Square but still in a quiet location. This is the place! Very nice hotel, although the rooms were a bit small. The AC didn't work very well in our room either. Other then that, I would highly reccomend this hotel. Very easy to get to, take the vapparetto to the San Zaccaria stop and walk about 2 minutes and you're there. The staff was helpful and very easy to communicate with. The buffet breakfast was at their sister Hotel Sovia and was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: LisaCB
Reviews.Content: Villa Igea was fantastic. Its literally round the corner from San Marco's Piazza and a 3 or 4 minute walk from the vaporetto. The hotel is part of a larger 4 star hotel. The rooms are lovely, Venetian style with fabric lined walls and the maid service superb. The Villa igea doesn't have its own restaurant so you eat breakfast (and dinner at a discount if you want it) in the four star restaurant. Its really just like 4star service at 3 star price! Villa Igea is a fab place to explore Venice from and the staff are friendly and soooooo helpful. We were VERY pleased with our choice and would go back to the exact same location again.

Reviews.Title: “More than a Three Star”
Reviews.Author: PaBaci
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect. Just meters away from the Grand Canal and minutes from St. Mark's Square. The rooms are lovely, spacious, and clean with all the amenities (hairdryer, safe, tv, alarm phone). At the Savoia & Jolanda (the four star main hotel) an american buffet breakfast is served (cereals, fruits, yogurts, eggs, meats, cheeses, cereals, breads and rolls, cakes, etc.). The staff is friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you, Hotel Igea!”
Reviews.Author: BJ1700
Reviews.Content: August 1, 2005 We stayed in four hotels for our trip in Italy this summer...(Rome, Amalfi Coast, Florence, and Venice.) Our stay at Hotel Igea in Venice was by far the most pleasant. It was the best value for our money, very quiet, extremely convenient, and the staff was outstanding. We had spacious rooms, a small terrace overlooking a quiet plaza, and an added treat of eating breakfast in the four-star sister hotel just around the corner. Our rooms were newly decorated in extremely good taste with fabric covered walls, handpainted doors and venitian glass light fixtures. Hotel Igea contributed much in making our stay in Venice enjoyable and unforgetable.

HotelInfo.Name: Villa Igea
HotelInfo.Address: Campo San Zaccaria 4684, 30122 Venice, Italy
